reviews.text: Okay for what it's worth..a one night stop over..cheap & cheerful

Yes, it is cheap and situated in the city center. However: the pension is on the third floor with no elevator. It has only ONE toilet for all the guests - men and women. And "all the guests" might be quite a big number. The rooms are as big as an elevator's cabin, and some of them are stacked with beds from top to bottom. There are no windows facing a street, just small openings in the wall, facing another wall - one for each room. No air to breathe. The shower and the toilet are in the same room, so they can be used by only one person at a time. We waited for two hours - between 12 and 2 a.m. for a numerous Chinese group to pass through the toilet. There were some other people who waited even longer than us. On the next day the toilet was smeared with blood and spit toothpaste.

BEDBUGS!!!!!! Staying at Enebral was not the most pleasant experience. A part of the location, in the middle of Malsaña, what is amazing, the room and the toilet was not provided with the minimum you expect. But the worst part was yet to come, in the second day my friend started to find red lumps in my body that we thought was some kind of allergic reactions to any food. She was waiting to come back to France, where she lives to go to the doctor and take antiallergics Medicis. When we were flying back I also started to find red lumps on my body, exactly the same found on my friends. The doctor told us it was bed bugs. Me and my friend had to take lots of medicines, wash all our things, and spray insecticide all over everything, as we were afraid of having brought the hotel bedbugs to our places. We wrote them about it, especially to know their actions to prevent that this would happen again to others guests. That was more them one week ago, they haven't reply, not even a "Sorry". So, if you want some bedbugs adventure and a place that won't hear you in case of problem, you've found the perfect place.

Repurposed flat with shared bathrooms. Very basic, but very cheap. The room had a fan and a refrigerator, both very helpful fighting the heat wave. Recommended if you plan to spend most of the time walking the city.
I did not like it. Small dirty room near the bathroom. I could hear everything. I could not sleep at all. The bed was uncomfortable. The fan was so dirty. It was never cleaned.

reviews.text: Small single room, was very clean and cozy. Just across the street from Atocha Station made it a very convenient way to travel to Toledo for a day trip. The great museums are all nearby. Reception was always friendly.

This is a good place to stay if you do not plan to spend much time at the hostel and you can carry your own bags. The rooms are small. We stayed 2 nights.
Good points:
-  Great water pressure and showers (ranks among the best I have seen anywhere).
-  Great air conditioning.
-  Great location for (southern routes) train station and Metro. It was a 2 minute walk from the train station when we arrived at 2300. 
-  Great location for the airport bus. It takes about 8 minutes to walk to the airport bus through the train station. At 0636, it took 24 minutes for the bus to reach our terminal at Barajas A/P (5 euros).
-  Clean rooms.
-  Comfortable beds (albeit that we were so tired by the time we went to bed we could have slept anywhere).
-  Timely response to enter and leave the building at odd hours.
-  Elevator (and stairs).
-  Very affordable places to eat nearby.
-  In central Madrid.
Other:
-  No safe for valuables.
-  1st floor (traffic noise during the day).
-  Small rooms (travel light).
I would stay there again.

reviews.text: Very good location, the price we paid was perfect for what we got. The Internet was okay, the staff was friendly. It doesn't have a lift but apart from that it was good and clean.

This hostel is perfectly located in the centre of Madrid just few meters off Sol. It has basic rooms but very clean this is a budget Hostel so don't expect luxurious rooms but perfect to explore the city and the nearby places like Toledo or Segovia. The staff are very friendly and are always willing to help. One thing I really liked is the impressive wifi speed more than the average of Hostels and basic Hotels.

Great room (single) with a window, ceiling fan and own bathroom. Friendly people. Location is excellent.  Only downside is no air conditioner (which ordinarily wouldnt be a problem as the room generally stays cool).

All you can expect from cheap hostel in the city center. Rooms are small but clean, bathroom as well. WiFi, towels, fan are included. There could be a small language barrier between you and the staff,  if you don't speak Spanish but Violeta is very kind and helpful. If you speak/understand Italian or French, you'll be fine. Four stars instead of  five is for very thin walls between rooms. You can hear your neighbors conversations and all what is happening in the hall. It didn't bother me much, but for some people it could be a no-go. Other than that everything is fine for the price and location.
The room for 2 was very spacious, and everything is clean. It's far from glamourous, but you're not finding anything cheaper so well located.

reviews.text: Location is very good and the rooms are well equipped but some at 6:00 am I heard music with a high volume
Excellent location between Puerta del Sol, Gran Via and Plaza España. Very good quality for the price and perfect attention from the owner and workers.
Very central location. Basic but ideal for backpackers. Not suitable for families.

A very pleasant stay!  

The hostel is basic, but it has everything you'll need, and good heavens you cannot beat the price for the center of Madrid!!!  Fridge & microwave allow you to be somewhat self-sustaining to save even more money.  

As a solo traveler plus pet, staying here for ~12 days, my experience here has been extremely positive!  The staff are very friendly (they're as interested in the comfort of my cat as they are in my own comfort!) and Sara (the housekeeper) goes out of her way to communicate a friendly chat every day, even though we don't share a common language!  If you're an Anglophone, the gentleman that runs the front desk speaks enough English to answer your questions, so all-in-all it's a fairly straightforward to figure out how to get what you need while staying here.  

Other review sites have reviews that talk about how noisy it is, how dirty it is, etc...  I have not had any such experience!  It is quiet at night (their TV-off time is 11:00 as per the instructions on the door, though I don't know if they enforce that...).  I am getting clean towels every day.  Garbage is emptied every day. Sheets changed every few days, Wireless connection is working perfectly (900kb/s download speed last night!)... nothing to complain about at all, as far as I am concerned, though I admit, I'm a pretty low-maintenance kind of guy...    In summary, it's a perfectly nice place!  Small, basic, but it has everything you'll need, and is in a PERFECT location.  I had far lower expectations given the price, so I am pleasantly surprised!

YMMV...  Good luck travelers!    NOTE:  IT ISN'T OBVIOUS HOW TO GET INTO THE HOSTEL!  YOU HAVE TO RING THE BUZZER FOR 4th FLOOR (button on the right-hand side of the door, 4th floor is labeled "Hostal").  If you don't do this, you'll be standing out on the street for a loooong time!  ...trust me!  LOL!

En cuanto a la habitación es lo que describen, una cama doble con baño privado.

reviews.text: This place is located very central in Madrid. The rooms appear clean and the personal is friendly. The only negative point for me was that it was very loud because my room was direct in front of the main road. But for sure i would come back.
Best location in Madrid, you get private bathroom and decent room for €40.
We visited a friend who was staying here, and it seemed very reasonable for the price they paid. Could do with some modernising in places though as the rooms seemed very outdated.

The only thing I liked about this hotel was the location, it's located in the center of Madrid, close to all centers of interest.
The Wi-Fi service was quite slow, the bed sheets looked very old,  but that didn't matter much to me because the location was awesome and the price was reasonable for the service offered.

Attention, ARNAQUE! Les propriétaires de cet hostel en possèdent d'autres, moins bien centrés (c.f. leur page web mise en lien...) et une fois que vous faites une réservation pour leur hôtel très bien situé, ils prétextent une coupure d'électricité dans la chambre pour vous reloger dans leurs autres hostels !!! Très inconvénient et désagréable !! N'y réservez aucune chambre, dans le même bâtiment il y a l'hotel Valencia ou le Helena II qui sont de bien meilleure qualité!! Et le staff ne parle qu'espagnol (espagnol de Cuba en plus, pas des plus faciles à comprendre...)
****

Nosotras habíamos reservado este hostal justamente en este hostal por su situación pero al llegar nos dijeron que no tenia luz en la habitación y que por eso teníamos que irnos a otro hostal suyo (santa barbara) (pero sin decirnos que era suyo, solo diciendo que era el unico libre) . No queríamos (esta lejos de la zona que nos interesaba) entonces fuimos al hostal valencia en el mismo edificio gran via 44 (muy buen hostal). Conclusión :  esa mujer nos mintió -->  NO RESERVEN EN ESTE HOSTAL!!!!
****
Don't go there. They overbook the rooms, then they lie to you telling you there is no light in the room and they try to make you go in another of their hostels but far from the city center. The service was awful because the lady was lying to us, maybe she though we couldn't speak spanish and we didn't know Madrid so we wouldn't have said anything. She was lucky that we were there for holiday and didn't have time to lose going to the police because we could have gone : she refused to give me a complaint sheet and slammed the door at my face. VERY BAD HOSTEL, don't book any room there if you don't want to be homeless in Madrid!!!!!

reviews.text: Only speak Spanish, rooms small, and no soap in shared bathrooms. Each bedroom has sink with soap. No Smoking sign, not sure for how long, but hallway doesn't smell. Satisfactory

Overall good place for a budget stay. Halls smell of smoke a bit but rooms overall seem to be okay. Airflow is a bit stuffy so using the fan is a necessity. Close to center of town and lots of restaurants

A good hotel if you need a cheap central and clean hotel with the basic ammentities. We needed a central hotel for a quick lay over, and arrived late. The check-inn was hassel-free and the room was clean, but simple. However, rooms are poorly isolated and the water pipes make a lot of noise so it woke us up during the night. This reduces our score.

What kind of hostel in a major city (especially beside a huge transit station) does not speak English? Even broken English would be enough.  

Place was weird to get into (no front reception, had to buzz in and walk up stairs.  Must just be the architecture in the area) and smelled like cigarette smoke.  It was dark and grungy and really outdated.  

The shared bathroom was pretty disgusting too.  See picture I took.

Bedroom was tiny and smelled like smoke too.  There was a few white stains on the sheets as well...
Also the double sized bed was tiny and could barely fit two people.  There is no air conditioning (it does say this on the website so this is my own fault) so be prepared to be cooked if you're in Madrid during the hot summer.

Let's just say they made the pictures on hostelworld look way better than it was.  

We ended up leaving within a hour and checked into the AC hotel (Marriott) nearby to purge our memory of that place.  We're backpackers that have been all around Europe for the past month and are pretty open minded but that was by far the worse.

Only would recommend if you have a small budget, smoke (or don't care about the smell), will only use the place to sleep and/or aren't sharing a bed with someone. Otherwise just go somewhere else.

This place reminded me of the movie "Hostel".
Top location, very nice staff, and good value for money. Loved it!

reviews.text: This is the nastiest place I have ever stayed. The room smells heavily of mold. The toilet drip noisily. The floor tiles are broken and partially held in place with clear tape. The walls are scuffed and dirty. The safe was supposedly not working, but on check out we learned we should have been provided a key. The common area outside the room was piled with linen,  amongst the dirty cups and various item meant to be discarded.  The walls appeared to have undergone some major water damage as the were peeling away in two foot long chunks. We checked out after the first night and would have left sooner. Had we been able to secure a new reservation so late. However we were still charged for the next night. This place should not be in business.

Good hotel. Amazing location right in the heart of Madrid! Just a few metres from Sol, Gran Vía, Plaza Mayor. A couple of minutes walk from Royal Palace. Plenty of bars, restaurants and coffee shops to choose from. Be aware a fantastic location like this one means lots of noise too. 

Room wasn't too big but spacious enough. Same goes for the shower. They offer toiletries and towels. Bed was extremely comfortable, made it hard to wake up! 
There's a mini fridge in the room and an electric kettle but only plastic glasses so we couldn't use it.

WiFi was the faster we have ever experienced in a hotel! TV didn't work very well, couldn't even turn it off neither change language settings.

Staff was very welcoming and friendly. Good price, 47€/night.

Bad thing was walls are extremely thin. Woke up many times in the middle of the night by people arriving/leaving/going to the bathroom... Too much noise and too little respect for other guests.
Lovely and secure hotel in Madrid city centre

It's Clean and the location is convinient. but the heating system really got on our nerves. It's only on for a couple of hours during the evening and then it's turned off again. Which is cruel considering it's the middle of January   and we were freezing most of our stay there.
Very, very basic for the price. Noisy and nothing in the room at all.

What a hole! Literally! The crappiest hotel I've ever stayed at! This rather hostel cost us almoat $100. Super dirty, worn out furniture, such a tiny bathroom that it's just impossible to turn around (I'm not exaggerating!), and the walls are so thin that you hear how people turn in bed behind the wall. html_attributions: Hotel ibis budget Madrid Centro las Ventas
Hotel ibis budget Madrid Centro las Ventas

reviews.text: Nice and very clean hotel. Room was adequate. Breakfast was good. Friendly staff. Will stay again. Close to metro, dream fit gym and the plaza toro.

Typical ibis budget hotel - very small rooms but they have everything you need for a comfortable stay. Rooms are cleaned daily and staff are very accommodating. Make sure you choose a room which is not facing the street as those have windows which do not open.
Breakfast is nothing special but enough really.
The location is also great - there is a metro station nearby and it's only a 10-15 minutes trip from the center or most of the sights you might want to visit.

It's budget,  you get what you pay for. Staff friendly and helpful, rooms very average but clean. What I didn't like was the saloon door for the toilet so you you could hear what was going on, and the fact you couldn't have a private shower (it's clear glass and in the room). As a shared room it was uncomfortable, however if you're looking for a cheap stay, it's well located, beside a great metro line, and close to a lovely local bar for tostada and cafe in the morning but. don't expect the Radisson. It is what it says it is, a one star hotel and I would stay again.
Good place. Warm welcoming. English speaking staff and helpful.
Nice staff, very clean and comfortable, delicious breakfest. Excellent.

adr_address: Calle de Carretas, 31, 28012 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Carretas, 31, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: Hostal Bahía

reviews.text: Very good
Good hotel

*** The Good ***
keep in mind that this is a "hostel" don't expect hotel level, it's a converted house. 
all in all it was clean and nice but the only good thing about this place it's the location... that is all.
it is located few minutes from "puerta del sol" that has metro stations that make travel easy
but you can walk by foot to most places you need to visit anyway.
and the WiFi was good.

*** The Bad ***
* Well... i ordered the room with "shared bathroom" what it means in real life is a room without windows at all, added 60 euro's to switch to a room with a shower that had external window.
* the staff woman was "ok" it's the best i can say, rude a bit but i can live with that. 
* with it being in the "del sol" don't expect it to be quiet at night (but that was expected) .
* They only gave us one key so we had trouble when we didn't travel together.
* the place is overpriced when compared to the price in their website, learned it too late, but all in all when you do check this is a cheap option to stay in central location in madrid.

Horrible place, despite the great location. The rooms DO NOT HAVE WINDOWS!! You can choose between opening a pannel over the door and get tons of light and noise from the hall every time someone goes to the common WC during the night, or close it and slowly roast due to the heat. Of course, you can try the ceiling fan, but it only works when the lights are on. Zero intimacy - I sneezed and I could clearly hear a "bless you" coming from the room in front of ours. Two common showers that don't work at the same time and a single common WC for the whole hotel. Very old beds and matresses which are barely 1,80m long (5'11"). I could barely sleep, and it wasn't even cheap.

Pues a ver... Si no fuera porque los recepcionistas gritan por la mañana y hablar super fuerte e incluso parece que discutan.Me hace gracia, piden silencio y todos los huéspedes guardaban silencio, y ellos mismos son los que crean la falta de silencio. Yo no creo que vuelva.

It was very clean and the decor was pleasing. The lady in charge is quite cool and we could check in our room at 11 am the moment we entered. Would definitely stay again!
Nice and clean room but small bathroom and noise isolation to the outside is not good at all

The owner lady does not speak English, but by knowing a few spanish words (or if you are better than average in the Activity board game) there is no problem to understand and make yourself understood. Everything is just around. The room is very clean. Recommended if you like to be in the heart of this lovely city.

Very accommodating, amazing location. Close to metro station Sol (3 minute walk) which takes you to the airport, and many restaurants and fast foods. Very clean and has absolutely everything you need. Decent wifi and we had our own bathroom. Big plus was the air conditioner as it was very hot when we were there (August). Luísa was very kind and helpful. If I'm ever in Madrid, I would definitely return!
Very nice owner, great location, clean room, private bathroom.

reviews.text: A nice hostal in city center near from St Ana Place and Sol
Clean and priceless~

Hotel moderno, remodelado recentemente. Decoração simples, simpática. Quartos espaçosos, limpos e arrejados, com bom isolamento do exterior. Com janela e varadinha para a rua. Ar condicionado, TV e secador. Apesar de não ter pequeno-almoco, existe o cuidado de ter disponível um cafeteira com Nescafé e infusão, acompanhado de um bolinho. Tem uma pequena mesa muito prática para um lanche e uma pequena secretária. WC super limpo, moderno, com secador de cabelo, com o cuidado de ter toalhitas desmaquilhante. O edifício histórico com vitrais e um elevador antigo com grades, muito bonito, silencioso. O funcionário é simpático, muito acessível e prestável. Localização perfeita, muito perto das Portas do Sol, com restaurante e supermercado na rua do hotel. Gostei muito, voltarei. Parabéns, aos proprietários, pensaram no bem estar do cliente. (Pequeno pormenor: adorei o design das portas) 😁
Extraordinario. Muy limpio, cómodo y la atención muy buena. Por su ubicación céntrica, favorece mucho el moverte por las zonas tipicas de Madrid. Sin duda, para volver.

Expectacular,limpio, cómodo, tranquilo, muy bien situado, detalles únicos,hervidor de agua con su café, infusión,pastitas, el aseo muy equipado. Todo nuevo y decoración muy chula. Personal...como en familia, muy buena atención. Totalmente recomendable...volveré seguro no, segurísimo.

reviews.text: Rooms are ok if you are never there. During the weekends there is too much noise on the street. The guy that works the night shift is very nice and helpful. Either they are very nice or believe they are better

Honestly one of the best hotels I've ever been in. The staff was so helpful and we could check-in an hour before the original time. The rooms are spotless and have a very funky look to them. With all the colours and posters on the wall you will always feel happy and have a good night of sleep. Rooms are air-conditioned and toilet articles are always provided. The location is just perfect just in the middle of Puerta del Sol. It might seem pricy but in reality you are saving all the transportation money you would have paid if you stayed somewhere a bit further from the city center. Another good thing is the presence of rooms with any number of beds you want like up to four beds a room. I recommend.

adr_address: C/ Camarillas, 5-7, 28042 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: C/ Camarillas, 5-7, 28042 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Barajas Plaza

reviews.text:
A simple hotel that offers clean and sensibly comfortable rooms to sleep in, Hotel Barajas Plaza is a fine stop if you're looking for a place to flop before running to the airport. It's  close to some good restaurants, about 500m from the Metro, and near some modest shopping options.

Pros: The price seems to be right, as a rule, and you get the spare, but reasonable accommodations that you pay for. Close proximity to airport, Metro, and restaurants. 

Cons: Not much luxury to be had. Elevator died on us, so may not be terribly reliable. The thermostat in our room didn't seem to work well, but our travelling companions were fine.
great stay over for the night before the next day flight out. Get the 101 bus from airport for € 1.30 instead of a €20 taxi fare

If sleep is what you’re looking for, you’ll have better luck at the airport.  This place is LOUD!  Hard floors and hallways that acted like an echo chamber — it was like I had my own private flamenco dancer in my room at 2am.  The staff was nice enough, but hotels are supposed to offer you a place to actually sleep.  What I wouldn’t give for just a few minutes of that.  😢
Good place for a connecting flight. Clean simple room. 15 minutes walking distance from the airport, saves you 20 euros on a taxi. Metro station also on walking distance.

Staff are very helpful and kind. The room was ridiculously clean.
It's literally a 7-minute bus ride to the airport! 
You can walk to the nearest subway station in 7-10 minutes.      There's a quaint park/square on the corner surrounded with cute restaurants/bars, which is a relaxing alternative if you want to take a break from the crowds and city noise of central Madrid.

Well located and with nice and spacious bedrooms.
Affordable with a great location. Nice rooms, accommodating friendly staff. Only downside is lack of control of thermostat in room, it can sometimes get stuffy and warm.

Difficult to fault at the price, clean, comfortable, quiet (for the centre of Madrid!).  2-3 minutes walk from Sol, fantastic location for exploring Madrid. Helpful staff, useful locker room for luggage to pack a bit more in before your flight.

Was very dated, no locks on bathroom doors which is very unwelcomed and just very tired. Staff were helpful though and the internet did work in places but was a faff to do. The worst part was that the heating can only be turned on or off for all the rooms so we were boiling as the Spanish guests were cold as we visited during their winter.

Great location and friendly staff. The price could be better but it's Accor standard, so you know exactly what you are getting for your money, which can give you peace of mind when you don't know the city.
Rooms pretty standard, breakfast was ok, very clean and great location. Poor impression because of front desk stuff.

Clean sheets, good internet connextion, excellent location

adr_address: Calle de Hortaleza, 7, 28004 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Hortaleza, 7, 28004 Madrid, Spain
name: Pension Lemus

reviews.text:
Location of this hotel is great. It's just off Gran Via and is within a short walking distance from most of the tourist spots. There are numerous restaurants, tapas bars and shops all around the area.

The price of the room was really good for Central Madrid. We had a small balcony overlooking a busy street, handy if you just wanted to sit and people watch for a while. We also had a small attached bathroom, that we didn't book, which was a nice bonus.

On the downside; the street could get very noisy at night, might be a problem if you're a light sleeper, and the toilet smelled pretty bad. The girl on reception didn't speak any English and she wasn't really friendly.

Pros: -The price, as it is quite cheap for a room for two persons. -I've got a double sized bed for the price of a standard one. -You can check out at night, if you have to leave early. - Location, in Gran Via, center of the city. Cons: - There is a lot of noise during the night, as the street gathers some bars and it may be hard to fall asleep. - The customer service could be improved. - The place looks pretty old and dirty (even though the room is ok). Overall, I would only recommend this place if you are looking for something cheap in the center of the city. If you are staying several days in the city and you prefer a confortable place to rest properly, you should book other place.
I lived in a 4th gloor apartment Atocha.

It's like students dormitory in Soviet Union... no hanger for the towel in bathroom and liquid soap looks like it was was mixed with water 60/40% and you can't sleep because of  constant noise of water coming...

Great and cheap place to stay. Staff only speaks spanish, but its easy to stay there. Easy check in and out, no complications, clean room. For that price it was more than great. Thanks for the cheap and good place to be.

reviews.text: Location couldn't be more central. Super-friendly reception staff. Small but comfortable single room - amazing value for Central Madrid.

Hostal Santo Domingo (hostal means smaller, independent hotel; it's not a hostel) is conveniently located about 2 minutes walk from the Gran Via. It is on the 2nd and 3rd floors of an older building with a secured ground floor entrance. If you arrive at night, the entry door is a bit hard to see, but it is located next door to a pharmacy and also has a lit sign--look up towards the second floor. There is an intercom on the right side of the doorway and a very small elevator inside.  very good value

Good. Our first "hostal" experience. Clearly small and minimal accomodations. Staff were nice and spoke English. Parking options aren't great. Good deal but it may be possible to find a competitive hotel with much nicer amenities.
Too expensive for a hostal
Nice place for good value. Perfect localisation and nice service

formatted_address: Calle de Hortaleza, 74, 28004 Madrid, Spain
name: Hostal Chueca

reviews.text:
Definitely changes the word hostel! The location is the best: its literally in the middle of everything you want to see from Madrid.
Clean and a quiet atmosphere. Great customer service! Will be booking for the next time I am back in Madrid!
So far so good. The staff is super nice, breakfast is amazing and the room rocks. You should definitely keep this place in mind when looking for a low to medium cost trip.
Chill but fancy place for young adults to hang, sleep, and eat. Breakfast is only €3.50 for an all you can eat pastries, juice, tea, coffee, cheese, meat, and fruit!
Nice quality/value ratio, but not as offered on pics. Stuff is helpfull and friendly!

Really cute and well decorated hostel. Had a single room with my boyfriend. Spacious but heating wasn't working properly just blowing cold air into the room in the middle of freezing January, wifi was constantly disconnected on and off. Mattress was really sinking to the floor causing back pain to both of us. Gotta say the location is amazing.  Chueca has lots of nice places to go for bites and drinks. Conveniently reached by metro as well. Price isn't so bad but the place really needs bit more attention to detail.

adr_address: Calle de la Montera, 47, 28013 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de la Montera, 47, 28013 Madrid, Spain
name: Hostal Luis XV

reviews.text: Very sketchy and disgusting. The receptionist was very rude and uneducated and looked like he was on drugs and was missing a few teeth. I checked in for a night and came in at midnight and the receptionist said that he could not check me in because the check in was not until the morning which is not the case anywhere in the world (usually at a normal place on like PLANET EARTH, it’s check in ANYTIME after 3, check out by 12). I asked him where he expected me to sleep and informed him that I was already charged for the stay which obviously entitles me the keys to my room...and he couldn’t do anything. I ended up re-reserving at an acceptable place to say the least. Awful place don’t go there unless you want to deal with uneducated and unhelpful people. Peace. Oh and the building is not what’s shown on google it’s one floor in this building.
Great Hostal! Very clean and friendly. Amazing view over Madrid!

Hostal Luis is an excellent place to stay for a city break. Stayed there from Friday to Tuesday morning and our flight was delayed on the Friday so we arrived late, but no problems whatsoever checking in. The location was literally 2 minutes from Sol, which is the centre of Madrid. Because it was so close to centre, we could walk everywhere. The room was very clean, Wi-Fi, air con and a TV with some Spanish channels. Price is excellent, especially considering how close you are to the centre. Receptionists were very friendly, even going as far as to create a list of things for us to do and free exhibitions that were going on that weekend. You have to leave your key with the hostal whenever you leave which could be annoying for some but you have a safe in the room. Shampoo/gel and soap on arrival and you've got a 24 hour supermercardo literally seconds away for any extra bits you need. Would 100% come again!
Good and cheep in the middle of Madrid.
Good view and good location. Bad smell in the room, probably because of the air conditioner, but room was clean and I didn't have a bad time.

adr_address: Plaza de Celenque, 1 - 4º Izq., 28013 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Plaza de Celenque, 1 - 4º Izq., 28013 Madrid, Spain
name: Hostel RC Miguel Angel

reviews.text:
It was cheap, but I've stayed in much nicer hostels for the same price. It's in the center of  Madrid, but it's so close to Plaza de Sol that you can hear people yelling and trucks going by all throuth the night. The kitchen is very small and not well equipped. The lockers didn't seem secure at all. It didn't smell very good and didn't seem especially clean, and the decor was a bit weird. There are quite a few elderly people living in the hostel, which was also a bit weird. At one point paramedics came in to help one of them.

The owners seemed very nice, but I would not stay there again if I went back to Madrid.
The place is really good for the price. Everything is clean and the beds are comfortable. The hostel is located on 4th floor, but there is a lifter from the ground floor.
I didn't sleep there, i slept Plaza de Celenque, 1 - 4º Izq., 28013 Madrid, Spain in Numero 15

I can't believe this place is rated highly. I booked checking the rating but really disappointed and had to cancel the reservation after one night. no clean linen, no covers on the blanket, and there were bugs on the bed. :( 
Breakfast is next to nothing.
The owners were helpful and seemed nice though.
Feels very home-y and the people are very welcoming. The location could not be better!! Fairly cheap as well and I met a few lovely people during my stay

adr_address: Calle de Carretas, 13, 28012 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Carretas, 13, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: Hostal El Pilar

reviews.text: Great location near the metro. Clean room. 24 hours service desk. There is luggage room. No breakfast. Shampoo was not renewed for the second day of stay.

A cheep and convinent acccomodation in the heart if Madrid. Not only for tourists - I have bern here to participate on a conference, but I was absolutely satisfied with this accomodation. But, on the other hand, the Puerta del Sol is just a hundred metres away.

There was mold in the bathrooms and the rooms were not very clean. I guess you get what you pay for so choose wisely. The only thing that was good about this place was the price. I will choose another place to stay going forward.

reviews.text: Okay for what it's worth..a one night stop over..cheap & cheerful

Yes, it is cheap and situated in the city center. However: the pension is on the third floor with no elevator. It has only ONE toilet for all the guests - men and women. And "all the guests" might be quite a big number. The rooms are as big as an elevator's cabin, and some of them are stacked with beds from top to bottom. There are no windows facing a street, just small openings in the wall, facing another wall - one for each room. No air to breathe. The shower and the toilet are in the same room, so they can be used by only one person at a time. We waited for two hours - between 12 and 2 a.m. for a numerous Chinese group to pass through the toilet. There were some other people who waited even longer than us. On the next day the toilet was smeared with blood and spit toothpaste.

BEDBUGS!!!!!! Staying at Enebral was not the most pleasant experience. A part of the location, in the middle of Malsaña, what is amazing, the room and the toilet was not provided with the minimum you expect. But the worst part was yet to come, in the second day my friend started to find red lumps in my body that we thought was some kind of allergic reactions to any food. She was waiting to come back to France, where she lives to go to the doctor and take antiallergics Medicis. When we were flying back I also started to find red lumps on my body, exactly the same found on my friends. The doctor told us it was bed bugs. Me and my friend had to take lots of medicines, wash all our things, and spray insecticide all over everything, as we were afraid of having brought the hotel bedbugs to our places. We wrote them about it, especially to know their actions to prevent that this would happen again to others guests. That was more them one week ago, they haven't reply, not even a "Sorry". So, if you want some bedbugs adventure and a place that won't hear you in case of problem, you've found the perfect place.

Repurposed flat with shared bathrooms. Very basic, but very cheap. The room had a fan and a refrigerator, both very helpful fighting the heat wave. Recommended if you plan to spend most of the time walking the city.
I did not like it. Small dirty room near the bathroom. I could hear everything. I could not sleep at all. The bed was uncomfortable. The fan was so dirty. It was never cleaned.

reviews.text: Small single room, was very clean and cozy. Just across the street from Atocha Station made it a very convenient way to travel to Toledo for a day trip. The great museums are all nearby. Reception was always friendly.

This is a good place to stay if you do not plan to spend much time at the hostel and you can carry your own bags. The rooms are small. We stayed 2 nights.
Good points:
-  Great water pressure and showers (ranks among the best I have seen anywhere).
-  Great air conditioning.
-  Great location for (southern routes) train station and Metro. It was a 2 minute walk from the train station when we arrived at 2300. 
-  Great location for the airport bus. It takes about 8 minutes to walk to the airport bus through the train station. At 0636, it took 24 minutes for the bus to reach our terminal at Barajas A/P (5 euros).
-  Clean rooms.
-  Comfortable beds (albeit that we were so tired by the time we went to bed we could have slept anywhere).
-  Timely response to enter and leave the building at odd hours.
-  Elevator (and stairs).
-  Very affordable places to eat nearby.
-  In central Madrid.
Other:
-  No safe for valuables.
-  1st floor (traffic noise during the day).
-  Small rooms (travel light).
I would stay there again.

reviews.text: Very good location, the price we paid was perfect for what we got. The Internet was okay, the staff was friendly. It doesn't have a lift but apart from that it was good and clean.

It has basic rooms but very clean this is a budget Hostel so don't expect luxurious rooms but perfect to explore the city and the nearby places like Toledo or Segovia. The staff are very friendly and are always willing to help. One thing I really liked is the impressive wifi speed more than the average of Hostels and basic Hotels.

All you can expect from cheap hostel in the city center. Rooms are small but clean, bathroom as well. WiFi, towels, fan are included. There could be a small language barrier between you and the staff,  if you don't speak Spanish but Violeta is very kind and helpful. If you speak/understand Italian or French, you'll be fine. Four stars instead of  five is for very thin walls between rooms. You can hear your neighbors conversations and all what is happening in the hall. It didn't bother me much, but for some people it could be a no-go. Other than that everything is fine for the price and location.
The room for 2 was very spacious, and everything is clean. It's far from glamourous, but you're not finding anything cheaper so well located.

reviews.text: Location is very good and the rooms are well equipped but some at 6:00 am I heard music with a high volume

A very pleasant stay!  

The hostel is basic, but it has everything you'll need, and good heavens you cannot beat the price for the center of Madrid!!!  Fridge & microwave allow you to be somewhat self-sustaining to save even more money.  

As a solo traveler plus pet, staying here for ~12 days, my experience here has been extremely positive!  The staff are very friendly (they're as interested in the comfort of my cat as they are in my own comfort!) and Sara (the housekeeper) goes out of her way to communicate a friendly chat every day, even though we don't share a common language!  If you're an Anglophone, the gentleman that runs the front desk speaks enough English to answer your questions, so all-in-all it's a fairly straightforward to figure out how to get what you need while staying here.  

Other review sites have reviews that talk about how noisy it is, how dirty it is, etc...  I have not had any such experience!  It is quiet at night (their TV-off time is 11:00 as per the instructions on the door, though I don't know if they enforce that...).  I am getting clean towels every day.  Garbage is emptied every day. Sheets changed every few days, Wireless connection is working perfectly (900kb/s download speed last night!)... nothing to complain about at all, as far as I am concerned, though I admit, I'm a pretty low-maintenance kind of guy...    In summary, it's a perfectly nice place!  Small, basic, but it has everything you'll need, and is in a PERFECT location.  I had far lower expectations given the price, so I am pleasantly surprised!

YMMV...  Good luck travelers!    NOTE:  IT ISN'T OBVIOUS HOW TO GET INTO THE HOSTEL!  YOU HAVE TO RING THE BUZZER FOR 4th FLOOR (button on the right-hand side of the door, 4th floor is labeled "Hostal").  If you don't do this, you'll be standing out on the street for a loooong time!  ...trust me!  LOL!

reviews.text: I stayed 4 nights and I really liked the place. It was clean and cozy. The shared bathrooms are always clean and they tidy up your room every morning. The location is great, central to everything in Madrid.

Location is amazing! The rooms aren't anything spectacular but they are simple and have what you need. The employees were very nice but do not speak English so if you are not at least semi proficient in Spanish you might have some trouble. Also there is a lot of noise at night but it didn't bother me much personally.

One of the worst hotel I have ever visited. The sink and shower was "inside" the room (so much for a private bath). The bed is too small for 2 people. It is like a single bed time x 1.5. The place is noisy. The room is small. Can't believe I paid 35 euro per night for this. The only good thing is location. WiFi works fine.
Top

reviews.text: This place is located very central in Madrid. The rooms appear clean and the personal is friendly. The only negative point for me was that it was very loud because my room was direct in front of the main road. But for sure i would come back.
Best location in Madrid, you get private bathroom and decent room for €40.
We visited a friend who was staying here, and it seemed very reasonable for the price they paid. Could do with some modernising in places though as the rooms seemed very outdated.

The only thing I liked about this hotel was the location, it's located in the center of Madrid, close to all centers of interest.
The Wi-Fi service was quite slow, the bed sheets looked very old,  but that didn't matter much to me because the location was awesome and the price was reasonable for the service offered.

Attention, ARNAQUE! Les propriétaires de cet hostel en possèdent d'autres, moins bien centrés (c.f. leur page web mise en lien...) et une fois que vous faites une réservation pour leur hôtel très bien situé, ils prétextent une coupure d'électricité dans la chambre pour vous reloger dans leurs autres hostels !!! Très inconvénient et désagréable !! N'y réservez aucune chambre, dans le même bâtiment il y a l'hotel Valencia ou le Helena II qui sont de bien meilleure qualité!! Et le staff ne parle qu'espagnol (espagnol de Cuba en plus, pas des plus faciles à comprendre...)
****
Los dueños de este hostal poseen otros hostales un poco mas lejos del centro de Madrid (vean la pagina web...). Nosotras habíamos reservado este hostal justamente en este hostal por su situación pero al llegar nos dijeron que no tenia luz en la habitación y que por eso teníamos que irnos a otro hostal suyo (santa barbara) (pero sin decirnos que era suyo, solo diciendo que era el unico libre) . No queríamos (esta lejos de la zona que nos interesaba) entonces fuimos al hostal valencia en el mismo edificio gran via 44 (muy buen hostal). Al día siguiente fuimos al hostal Miami para ver si habían  la habitación pero la mujer no quiso dejarme ni entrar en el hall ni ver la habitacion ni dar me una hoja de reclamación. Conclusión :  esa mujer nos mintió -->  NO RESERVEN EN ESTE HOSTAL!!!!
****
Don't go there. They overbook the rooms, then they lie to you telling you there is no light in the room and they try to make you go in another of their hostels but far from the city center. The service was awful because the lady was lying to us, maybe she though we couldn't speak spanish and we didn't know Madrid so we wouldn't have said anything. She was lucky that we were there for holiday and didn't have time to lose going to the police because we could have gone : she refused to give me a complaint sheet and slammed the door at my face. VERY BAD HOSTEL, don't book any room there if you don't want to be homeless in Madrid!!!!!

reviews.text: Only speak Spanish, rooms small, and no soap in shared bathrooms. Each bedroom has sink with soap. No Smoking sign, not sure for how long, but hallway doesn't smell. Satisfactory

Overall good place for a budget stay. Halls smell of smoke a bit but rooms overall seem to be okay. Airflow is a bit stuffy so using the fan is a necessity. Close to center of town and lots of restaurants

A good hotel if you need a cheap central and clean hotel with the basic ammentities. We needed a central hotel for a quick lay over, and arrived late. The check-inn was hassel-free and the room was clean, but simple. However, rooms are poorly isolated and the water pipes make a lot of noise so it woke us up during the night. This reduces our score.

What kind of hostel in a major city (especially beside a huge transit station) does not speak English? Even broken English would be enough.  

Place was weird to get into (no front reception, had to buzz in and walk up stairs.  Must just be the architecture in the area) and smelled like cigarette smoke.  It was dark and grungy and really outdated.  

The shared bathroom was pretty disgusting too.  See picture I took.

Bedroom was tiny and smelled like smoke too.  There was a few white stains on the sheets as well...
Also the double sized bed was tiny and could barely fit two people.  There is no air conditioning (it does say this on the website so this is my own fault) so be prepared to be cooked if you're in Madrid during the hot summer.

Let's just say they made the pictures on hostelworld look way better than it was.  

We ended up leaving within a hour and checked into the AC hotel (Marriott) nearby to purge our memory of that place.  We're backpackers that have been all around Europe for the past month and are pretty open minded but that was by far the worse.

Only would recommend if you have a small budget, smoke (or don't care about the smell), will only use the place to sleep and/or aren't sharing a bed with someone. Otherwise just go somewhere else.

This place reminded me of the movie "Hostel".
Top location, very nice staff, and good value for money. Loved it!

reviews.text: This is the nastiest place I have ever stayed. The room smells heavily of mold. The toilet drip noisily. The floor tiles are broken and partially held in place with clear tape. The walls are scuffed and dirty. The safe was supposedly not working, but on check out we learned we should have been provided a key. The common area outside the room was piled with linen,  amongst the dirty cups and various item meant to be discarded.  The walls appeared to have undergone some major water damage as the were peeling away in two foot long chunks. We checked out after the first night and would have left sooner. Had we been able to secure a new reservation so late. However we were still charged for the next night. This place should not be in business.

Good hotel. Amazing location right in the heart of Madrid! Just a few metres from Sol, Gran Vía, Plaza Mayor. A couple of minutes walk from Royal Palace. Plenty of bars, restaurants and coffee shops to choose from. Be aware a fantastic location like this one means lots of noise too. 

Room wasn't too big but spacious enough. Same goes for the shower. They offer toiletries and towels. Bed was extremely comfortable, made it hard to wake up! 
There's a mini fridge in the room and an electric kettle but only plastic glasses so we couldn't use it.

WiFi was the faster we have ever experienced in a hotel! TV didn't work very well, couldn't even turn it off neither change language settings.

Staff was very welcoming and friendly. Good price, 47€/night.

Bad thing was walls are extremely thin. Woke up many times in the middle of the night by people arriving/leaving/going to the bathroom... Too much noise and too little respect for other guests.
Lovely and secure hotel in Madrid city centre
Nice rooms in amazing location. Perhaps a little overpriced compared to other hostels, but still ok.
Good location and clean room

It's Clean and the location is convinient. but the heating system really got on our nerves. It's only on for a couple of hours during the evening and then it's turned off again. Which is cruel considering it's the middle of January   and we were freezing most of our stay there.
Very, very basic for the price. Noisy and nothing in the room at all.

What a hole! Literally! The crappiest hotel I've ever stayed at! This rather hostel cost us almoat $100. Super dirty, worn out furniture, such a tiny bathroom that it's just impossible to turn around (I'm not exaggerating!), and the walls are so thin that you hear how people turn in bed behind the wall. You can even hear people talking several rooms away. This is really a hostel, not a hotel, and shouldn't cost more than maybe 30 bucks per noght at most. Crappy, dirty, overpriced depressing hole.

reviews.text: Nice and very clean hotel. Room was adequate. Breakfast was good. Friendly staff. Will stay again. Close to metro, dream fit gym and the plaza toro.

Typical ibis budget hotel - very small rooms but they have everything you need for a comfortable stay. Rooms are cleaned daily and staff are very accommodating. Make sure you choose a room which is not facing the street as those have windows which do not open.
Breakfast is nothing special but enough really.
The location is also great - there is a metro station nearby and it's only a 10-15 minutes trip from the center or most of the sights you might want to visit.

It's budget,  you get what you pay for. Staff friendly and helpful, rooms very average but clean. What I didn't like was the saloon door for the toilet so you you could hear what was going on, and the fact you couldn't have a private shower (it's clear glass and in the room). As a shared room it was uncomfortable, however if you're looking for a cheap stay, it's well located, beside a great metro line, and close to a lovely local bar for tostada and cafe in the morning but. don't expect the Radisson. It is what it says it is, a one star hotel and I would stay again.
Good place. Warm welcoming. English speaking staff and helpful.
Nice staff, very clean and comfortable, delicious breakfest. Excellent.

formatted_address: Calle de Carretas, 31, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: Hostal Bahía

reviews.text: Very good
Good hotel

*** The Good ***
keep in mind that this is a "hostel" don't expect hotel level, it's a converted house. 
all in all it was clean and nice but the only good thing about this place it's the location... that is all.
it is located few minutes from "puerta del sol" that has metro stations that make travel easy
but you can walk by foot to most places you need to visit anyway.
and the WiFi was good.

*** The Bad ***
* Well... i ordered the room with "shared bathroom" what it means in real life is a room without windows at all, added 60 euro's to switch to a room with a shower that had external window.
* the staff woman was "ok" it's the best i can say, rude a bit but i can live with that. 
* with it being in the "del sol" don't expect it to be quiet at night (but that was expected) .
* They only gave us one key so we had trouble when we didn't travel together.
* the place is overpriced when compared to the price in their website, learned it too late, but all in all when you do check this is a cheap option to stay in central location in madrid.

Horrible place, despite the great location. The rooms DO NOT HAVE WINDOWS!! You can choose between opening a pannel over the door and get tons of light and noise from the hall every time someone goes to the common WC during the night, or close it and slowly roast due to the heat. Of course, you can try the ceiling fan, but it only works when the lights are on. Zero intimacy - I sneezed and I could clearly hear a "bless you" coming from the room in front of ours. Two common showers that don't work at the same time and a single common WC for the whole hotel. Very old beds and matresses which are barely 1,80m long (5'11"). I could barely sleep, and it wasn't even cheap.

Pues a ver... Si no fuera porque los recepcionistas gritan por la mañana y hablar super fuerte e incluso parece que discutan.Me hace gracia, piden silencio y todos los huéspedes guardaban silencio, y ellos mismos son los que crean la falta de silencio. Yo no creo que vuelva.

reviews.text: A nice hostal in city center near from St Ana Place and Sol
Clean and priceless~

Hotel moderno, remodelado recentemente. Decoração simples, simpática. Quartos espaçosos, limpos e arrejados, com bom isolamento do exterior. Com janela e varadinha para a rua. Ar condicionado, TV e secador. Apesar de não ter pequeno-almoco, existe o cuidado de ter disponível um cafeteira com Nescafé e infusão, acompanhado de um bolinho. Tem uma pequena mesa muito prática para um lanche e uma pequena secretária. WC super limpo, moderno, com secador de cabelo, com o cuidado de ter toalhitas desmaquilhante. O edifício histórico com vitrais e um elevador antigo com grades, muito bonito, silencioso. O funcionário é simpático, muito acessível e prestável. Localização perfeita, muito perto das Portas do Sol, com restaurante e supermercado na rua do hotel. Gostei muito, voltarei. Parabéns, aos proprietários, pensaram no bem estar do cliente. (Pequeno pormenor: adorei o design das portas) 😁
Extraordinario. Muy limpio, cómodo y la atención muy buena. Por su ubicación céntrica, favorece mucho el moverte por las zonas tipicas de Madrid. Sin duda, para volver.

Expectacular,limpio, cómodo, tranquilo, muy bien situado, detalles únicos,hervidor de agua con su café, infusión,pastitas, el aseo muy equipado. Todo nuevo y decoración muy chula. Personal...como en familia, muy buena atención. Totalmente recomendable...volveré seguro no, segurísimo.

Honestly one of the best hotels I've ever been in. The staff was so helpful and we could check-in an hour before the original time. The rooms are spotless and have a very funky look to them. With all the colours and posters on the wall you will always feel happy and have a good night of sleep. Rooms are air-conditioned and toilet articles are always provided. The location is just perfect just in the middle of Puerta del Sol. It might seem pricy but in reality you are saving all the transportation money you would have paid if you stayed somewhere a bit further from the city center. Another good thing is the presence of rooms with any number of beds you want like up to four beds a room. I recommend.
