reviews.text: This place is located very central in Madrid. The rooms appear clean and the personal is friendly. The only negative point for me was that it was very loud because my room was direct in front of the main road. But for sure i would come back.
Best location in Madrid, you get private bathroom and decent room for €40.
We visited a friend who was staying here, and it seemed very reasonable for the price they paid. Could do with some modernising in places though as the rooms seemed very outdated.

The only thing I liked about this hotel was the location, it's located in the center of Madrid, close to all centers of interest.
The Wi-Fi service was quite slow, the bed sheets looked very old,  but that didn't matter much to me because the location was awesome and the price was reasonable for the service offered.

Attention, ARNAQUE! Les propriétaires de cet hostel en possèdent d'autres, moins bien centrés (c.f. leur page web mise en lien...) et une fois que vous faites une réservation pour leur hôtel très bien situé, ils prétextent une coupure d'électricité dans la chambre pour vous reloger dans leurs autres hostels !!! Très inconvénient et désagréable !! N'y réservez aucune chambre, dans le même bâtiment il y a l'hotel Valencia ou le Helena II qui sont de bien meilleure qualité!! Et le staff ne parle qu'espagnol (espagnol de Cuba en plus, pas des plus faciles à comprendre...)
****
Los dueños de este hostal poseen otros hostales un poco mas lejos del centro de Madrid (vean la pagina web...). Nosotras habíamos reservado este hostal justamente en este hostal por su situación pero al llegar nos dijeron que no tenia luz en la habitación y que por eso teníamos que irnos a otro hostal suyo (santa barbara) (pero sin decirnos que era suyo, solo diciendo que era el unico libre) . No queríamos (esta lejos de la zona que nos interesaba) entonces fuimos al hostal valencia en el mismo edificio gran via 44 (muy buen hostal). Al día siguiente fuimos al hostal Miami para ver si habían  la habitación pero la mujer no quiso dejarme ni entrar en el hall ni ver la habitacion ni dar me una hoja de reclamación. Conclusión :  esa mujer nos mintió -->  NO RESERVEN EN ESTE HOSTAL!!!!
****
Don't go there. They overbook the rooms, then they lie to you telling you there is no light in the room and they try to make you go in another of their hostels but far from the city center. The service was awful because the lady was lying to us, maybe she though we couldn't speak spanish and we didn't know Madrid so we wouldn't have said anything. She was lucky that we were there for holiday and didn't have time to lose going to the police because we could have gone : she refused to give me a complaint sheet and slammed the door at my face. VERY BAD HOSTEL, don't book any room there if you don't want to be homeless in Madrid!!!!!

reviews.text: Only speak Spanish, rooms small, and no soap in shared bathrooms. Each bedroom has sink with soap. No Smoking sign, not sure for how long, but hallway doesn't smell. Satisfactory

Overall good place for a budget stay. Halls smell of smoke a bit but rooms overall seem to be okay. Airflow is a bit stuffy so using the fan is a necessity. Close to center of town and lots of restaurants

A good hotel if you need a cheap central and clean hotel with the basic ammentities. We needed a central hotel for a quick lay over, and arrived late. The check-inn was hassel-free and the room was clean, but simple. However, rooms are poorly isolated and the water pipes make a lot of noise so it woke us up during the night. This reduces our score.

What kind of hostel in a major city (especially beside a huge transit station) does not speak English? Even broken English would be enough.  

Place was weird to get into (no front reception, had to buzz in and walk up stairs.  Must just be the architecture in the area) and smelled like cigarette smoke.  It was dark and grungy and really outdated.  

The shared bathroom was pretty disgusting too.  See picture I took.

Bedroom was tiny and smelled like smoke too.  There was a few white stains on the sheets as well...
Also the double sized bed was tiny and could barely fit two people.  There is no air conditioning (it does say this on the website so this is my own fault) so be prepared to be cooked if you're in Madrid during the hot summer.

Let's just say they made the pictures on hostelworld look way better than it was.  

We ended up leaving within a hour and checked into the AC hotel (Marriott) nearby to purge our memory of that place.  We're backpackers that have been all around Europe for the past month and are pretty open minded but that was by far the worse.

Only would recommend if you have a small budget, smoke (or don't care about the smell), will only use the place to sleep and/or aren't sharing a bed with someone. Otherwise just go somewhere else.

This place reminded me of the movie "Hostel".
Top location, very nice staff, and good value for money. Loved it!

reviews.text: This is the nastiest place I have ever stayed. The room smells heavily of mold. The toilet drip noisily. The floor tiles are broken and partially held in place with clear tape. The walls are scuffed and dirty. The safe was supposedly not working, but on check out we learned we should have been provided a key. The common area outside the room was piled with linen,  amongst the dirty cups and various item meant to be discarded.  The walls appeared to have undergone some major water damage as the were peeling away in two foot long chunks. We checked out after the first night and would have left sooner. Had we been able to secure a new reservation so late. However we were still charged for the next night. This place should not be in business.

Good hotel. Amazing location right in the heart of Madrid! Just a few metres from Sol, Gran Vía, Plaza Mayor. A couple of minutes walk from Royal Palace. Plenty of bars, restaurants and coffee shops to choose from. Be aware a fantastic location like this one means lots of noise too. 

Room wasn't too big but spacious enough. Same goes for the shower. They offer toiletries and towels. Bed was extremely comfortable, made it hard to wake up! 
There's a mini fridge in the room and an electric kettle but only plastic glasses so we couldn't use it.

WiFi was the faster we have ever experienced in a hotel! TV didn't work very well, couldn't even turn it off neither change language settings.

Staff was very welcoming and friendly. Good price, 47€/night.

Bad thing was walls are extremely thin. Woke up many times in the middle of the night by people arriving/leaving/going to the bathroom... Too much noise and too little respect for other guests.
Lovely and secure hotel in Madrid city centre
Nice rooms in amazing location. Perhaps a little overpriced compared to other hostels, but still ok.
Good location and clean room

reviews.text: Nice and very clean hotel. Room was adequate. Breakfast was good. Friendly staff. Will stay again. Close to metro, dream fit gym and the plaza toro.

Typical ibis budget hotel - very small rooms but they have everything you need for a comfortable stay. Rooms are cleaned daily and staff are very accommodating. Make sure you choose a room which is not facing the street as those have windows which do not open.
Breakfast is nothing special but enough really.
The location is also great - there is a metro station nearby and it's only a 10-15 minutes trip from the center or most of the sights you might want to visit.

It's budget,  you get what you pay for. Staff friendly and helpful, rooms very average but clean. What I didn't like was the saloon door for the toilet so you you could hear what was going on, and the fact you couldn't have a private shower (it's clear glass and in the room). As a shared room it was uncomfortable, however if you're looking for a cheap stay, it's well located, beside a great metro line, and close to a lovely local bar for tostada and cafe in the morning but. don't expect the Radisson. It is what it says it is, a one star hotel and I would stay again.
Good place. Warm welcoming. English speaking staff and helpful.

formatted_address: Calle de Carretas, 31, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: Hostal Bahía

reviews.text: Very good
Good hotel

*** The Good ***
keep in mind that this is a "hostel" don't expect hotel level, it's a converted house. 
all in all it was clean and nice but the only good thing about this place it's the location... that is all.
it is located few minutes from "puerta del sol" that has metro stations that make travel easy
but you can walk by foot to most places you need to visit anyway.
and the WiFi was good.

*** The Bad ***
* Well... i ordered the room with "shared bathroom" what it means in real life is a room without windows at all, added 60 euro's to switch to a room with a shower that had external window.
* the staff woman was "ok" it's the best i can say, rude a bit but i can live with that. 
* with it being in the "del sol" don't expect it to be quiet at night (but that was expected) .
* They only gave us one key so we had trouble when we didn't travel together.
* the place is overpriced when compared to the price in their website, learned it too late, but all in all when you do check this is a cheap option to stay in central location in madrid.

Horrible place, despite the great location. The rooms DO NOT HAVE WINDOWS!! You can choose between opening a pannel over the door and get tons of light and noise from the hall every time someone goes to the common WC during the night, or close it and slowly roast due to the heat. Of course, you can try the ceiling fan, but it only works when the lights are on. Zero intimacy - I sneezed and I could clearly hear a "bless you" coming from the room in front of ours. Two common showers that don't work at the same time and a single common WC for the whole hotel. Very old beds and matresses which are barely 1,80m long (5'11"). I could barely sleep, and it wasn't even cheap.

Pues a ver... Si no fuera porque los recepcionistas gritan por la mañana y hablar super fuerte e incluso parece que discutan.Me hace gracia, piden silencio y todos los huéspedes guardaban silencio, y ellos mismos son los que crean la falta de silencio. Yo no creo que vuelva.

reviews.text: A nice hostal in city center near from St Ana Place and Sol
Clean and priceless~

Hotel moderno, remodelado recentemente. Decoração simples, simpática. Quartos espaçosos, limpos e arrejados, com bom isolamento do exterior. Com janela e varadinha para a rua. Ar condicionado, TV e secador. Apesar de não ter pequeno-almoco, existe o cuidado de ter disponível um cafeteira com Nescafé e infusão, acompanhado de um bolinho. Tem uma pequena mesa muito prática para um lanche e uma pequena secretária. WC super limpo, moderno, com secador de cabelo, com o cuidado de ter toalhitas desmaquilhante. O edifício histórico com vitrais e um elevador antigo com grades, muito bonito, silencioso. O funcionário é simpático, muito acessível e prestável. Localização perfeita, muito perto das Portas do Sol, com restaurante e supermercado na rua do hotel. Gostei muito, voltarei. Parabéns, aos proprietários, pensaram no bem estar do cliente. (Pequeno pormenor: adorei o design das portas) 😁
Extraordinario. Muy limpio, cómodo y la atención muy buena. Por su ubicación céntrica, favorece mucho el moverte por las zonas tipicas de Madrid. Sin duda, para volver.

Expectacular,limpio, cómodo, tranquilo, muy bien situado, detalles únicos,hervidor de agua con su café, infusión,pastitas, el aseo muy equipado. Todo nuevo y decoración muy chula. Personal...como en familia, muy buena atención. Totalmente recomendable...volveré seguro no, segurísimo.

It might seem pricy but in reality you are saving all the transportation money you would have paid if you stayed somewhere a bit further from the city center. Another good thing is the presence of rooms with any number of beds you want like up to four beds a room. I recommend.

formatted_address: C/ Camarillas, 5-7, 28042 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Barajas Plaza

reviews.text:
A simple hotel that offers clean and sensibly comfortable rooms to sleep in, Hotel Barajas Plaza is a fine stop if you're looking for a place to flop before running to the airport. It's  close to some good restaurants, about 500m from the Metro, and near some modest shopping options.

Pros: The price seems to be right, as a rule, and you get the spare, but reasonable accommodations that you pay for. Close proximity to airport, Metro, and restaurants. 

Cons: Not much luxury to be had. Elevator died on us, so may not be terribly reliable. The thermostat in our room didn't seem to work well, but our travelling companions were fine.
great stay over for the night before the next day flight out. Get the 101 bus from airport for € 1.30 instead of a €20 taxi fare

If sleep is what you’re looking for, you’ll have better luck at the airport.  This place is LOUD!  Hard floors and hallways that acted like an echo chamber — it was like I had my own private flamenco dancer in my room at 2am.  The staff was nice enough, but hotels are supposed to offer you a place to actually sleep.  What I wouldn’t give for just a few minutes of that.  😢
Good place for a connecting flight. Clean simple room. 15 minutes walking distance from the airport, saves you 20 euros on a taxi. Metro station also on walking distance.

Staff are very helpful and kind. The room was ridiculously clean.
It's literally a 7-minute bus ride to the airport! 
You can walk to the nearest subway station in 7-10 minutes.      There's a quaint park/square on the corner surrounded with cute restaurants/bars, which is a relaxing alternative if you want to take a break from the crowds and city noise of central Madrid.

formatted_address: Calle de la Cruz, 14, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: Hostal Marlasca

reviews.text: Great room, excellent location but the walls were a little thin and the bathroom door didn't close (by design weirdly) so not a great deal of privacy. Cost and location can't be beaten though
Well located and with nice and spacious bedrooms.
Affordable with a great location. Nice rooms, accommodating friendly staff. Only downside is lack of control of thermostat in room, it can sometimes get stuffy and warm.

Difficult to fault at the price, clean, comfortable, quiet (for the centre of Madrid!).  2-3 minutes walk from Sol, fantastic location for exploring Madrid. Helpful staff, useful locker room for luggage to pack a bit more in before your flight.

Was very dated, no locks on bathroom doors which is very unwelcomed and just very tired. Staff were helpful though and the internet did work in places but was a faff to do. The worst part was that the heating can only be turned on or off for all the rooms so we were boiling as the Spanish guests were cold as we visited during their winter.

adr_address: Calle de Manuela Malasaña, 6, 28004 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Manuela Malasaña, 6, 28004 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel ibis Madrid Centro

reviews.text: Very friendly staff, the breakfast was good and honest for just 8 Euros. The rooms are in the typical Ibis standard. I'm only not going to five-star because the air-conditioning was not working (room temperature still ok) and the fact that on Saturday night we got a lot of noise from the street in our room.

Great location and friendly staff. The price could be better but it's Accor standard, so you know exactly what you are getting for your money, which can give you peace of mind when you don't know the city.
Rooms pretty standard, breakfast was ok, very clean and great location. Poor impression because of front desk stuff.
Super clean. Super staff. Nice breakfast. A big thatks to Ana that gave her best to make us feel good, thank you for your smile and care. We hope to come back.
Clean sheets, good internet connextion, excellent location

adr_address: Calle de Hortaleza, 7, 28004 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Hortaleza, 7, 28004 Madrid, Spain
name: Pension Lemus

reviews.text:
Location of this hotel is great. It's just off Gran Via and is within a short walking distance from most of the tourist spots. There are numerous restaurants, tapas bars and shops all around the area.

The price of the room was really good for Central Madrid. We had a small balcony overlooking a busy street, handy if you just wanted to sit and people watch for a while. We also had a small attached bathroom, that we didn't book, which was a nice bonus.

On the downside; the street could get very noisy at night, might be a problem if you're a light sleeper, and the toilet smelled pretty bad. The girl on reception didn't speak any English and she wasn't really friendly.

Pros: -The price, as it is quite cheap for a room for two persons. -I've got a double sized bed for the price of a standard one. -You can check out at night, if you have to leave early. - Location, in Gran Via, center of the city. Cons: - There is a lot of noise during the night, as the street gathers some bars and it may be hard to fall asleep. - The customer service could be improved. - The place looks pretty old and dirty (even though the room is ok). Overall, I would only recommend this place if you are looking for something cheap in the center of the city. If you are staying several days in the city and you prefer a confortable place to rest properly, you should book other place.
I lived in a 4th gloor apartment Atocha.

It's like students dormitory in Soviet Union... no hanger for the towel in bathroom and liquid soap looks like it was was mixed with water 60/40% and you can't sleep because of  constant noise of water coming...

Great and cheap place to stay. Staff only speaks spanish, but its easy to stay there. Easy check in and out, no complications, clean room. For that price it was more than great. Thanks for the cheap and good place to be.

adr_address: Calle de la Luna, 6, 28004 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de la Luna, 6, 28004 Madrid, Spain
name: Hostal Santo Domingo

reviews.text: Location couldn't be more central. Super-friendly reception staff. Small but comfortable single room - amazing value for Central Madrid.

Hostal Santo Domingo (hostal means smaller, independent hotel; it's not a hostel) is conveniently located about 2 minutes walk from the Gran Via. It is on the 2nd and 3rd floors of an older building with a secured ground floor entrance. If you arrive at night, the entry door is a bit hard to see, but it is located next door to a pharmacy and also has a lit sign--look up towards the second floor. There is an intercom on the right side of the doorway and a very small elevator inside.  very good value

Good. Our first "hostal" experience. Clearly small and minimal accomodations. Staff were nice and spoke English. Parking options aren't great. Good deal but it may be possible to find a competitive hotel with much nicer amenities.
Too expensive for a hostal
Nice place for good value. Perfect localisation and nice service

adr_address: Calle de Hortaleza, 74, 28004 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Hortaleza, 74, 28004 Madrid, Spain
name: Hostal Chueca

reviews.text:
Definitely changes the word hostel! The location is the best: its literally in the middle of everything you want to see from Madrid.
Clean and a quiet atmosphere. Great customer service! Will be booking for the next time I am back in Madrid!
So far so good. The staff is super nice, breakfast is amazing and the room rocks. You should definitely keep this place in mind when looking for a low to medium cost trip.
Chill but fancy place for young adults to hang, sleep, and eat. Breakfast is only €3.50 for an all you can eat pastries, juice, tea, coffee, cheese, meat, and fruit!
Nice quality/value ratio, but not as offered on pics. Stuff is helpfull and friendly!

Really cute and well decorated hostel. Had a single room with my boyfriend. Spacious but heating wasn't working properly just blowing cold air into the room in the middle of freezing January, wifi was constantly disconnected on and off. Mattress was really sinking to the floor causing back pain to both of us. Gotta say the location is amazing.  Chueca has lots of nice places to go for bites and drinks. Conveniently reached by metro as well. Price isn't so bad but the place really needs bit more attention to detail.

adr_address: Calle de la Montera, 47, 28013 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de la Montera, 47, 28013 Madrid, Spain
name: Hostal Luis XV

reviews.text: Very sketchy and disgusting. The receptionist was very rude and uneducated and looked like he was on drugs and was missing a few teeth. I checked in for a night and came in at midnight and the receptionist said that he could not check me in because the check in was not until the morning which is not the case anywhere in the world (usually at a normal place on like PLANET EARTH, it’s check in ANYTIME after 3, check out by 12). I asked him where he expected me to sleep and informed him that I was already charged for the stay which obviously entitles me the keys to my room...and he couldn’t do anything. I ended up re-reserving at an acceptable place to say the least. Awful place don’t go there unless you want to deal with uneducated and unhelpful people. Peace. Oh and the building is not what’s shown on google it’s one floor in this building.
Great Hostal! Very clean and friendly. Amazing view over Madrid!

Hostal Luis is an excellent place to stay for a city break. Stayed there from Friday to Tuesday morning and our flight was delayed on the Friday so we arrived late, but no problems whatsoever checking in. The location was literally 2 minutes from Sol, which is the centre of Madrid. Because it was so close to centre, we could walk everywhere. The room was very clean, Wi-Fi, air con and a TV with some Spanish channels. Price is excellent, especially considering how close you are to the centre. Receptionists were very friendly, even going as far as to create a list of things for us to do and free exhibitions that were going on that weekend. You have to leave your key with the hostal whenever you leave which could be annoying for some but you have a safe in the room. Shampoo/gel and soap on arrival and you've got a 24 hour supermercardo literally seconds away for any extra bits you need. Would 100% come again!
Good and cheep in the middle of Madrid.
Good view and good location. Bad smell in the room, probably because of the air conditioner, but room was clean and I didn't have a bad time.

adr_address: Plaza de Celenque, 1 - 4º Izq., 28013 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Plaza de Celenque, 1 - 4º Izq., 28013 Madrid, Spain
name: Hostel RC Miguel Angel

reviews.text:
It was cheap, but I've stayed in much nicer hostels for the same price. It's in the center of  Madrid, but it's so close to Plaza de Sol that you can hear people yelling and trucks going by all throuth the night. The kitchen is very small and not well equipped. The lockers didn't seem secure at all. It didn't smell very good and didn't seem especially clean, and the decor was a bit weird. There are quite a few elderly people living in the hostel, which was also a bit weird. At one point paramedics came in to help one of them.

The owners seemed very nice, but I would not stay there again if I went back to Madrid.
The place is really good for the price. Everything is clean and the beds are comfortable. The hostel is located on 4th floor, but there is a lifter from the ground floor.
I didn't sleep there, i slept Plaza de Celenque, 1 - 4º Izq., 28013 Madrid, Spain in Numero 15

I can't believe this place is rated highly. I booked checking the rating but really disappointed and had to cancel the reservation after one night. no clean linen, no covers on the blanket, and there were bugs on the bed. :( 
Breakfast is next to nothing.
The owners were helpful and seemed nice though.
Feels very home-y and the people are very welcoming. The location could not be better!! Fairly cheap as well and I met a few lovely people during my stay

adr_address: Calle de Carretas, 13, 28012 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Carretas, 13, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: Hostal El Pilar

reviews.text: Great location near the metro. Clean room. 24 hours service desk. There is luggage room. No breakfast. Shampoo was not renewed for the second day of stay.

A cheep and convinent acccomodation in the heart if Madrid. Not only for tourists - I have bern here to participate on a conference, but I was absolutely satisfied with this accomodation. Rooms are rather small buz good enouth for sleeping. Rooms looking to the street may be a bit noisy but those facing to the internal are abdolutely quiet. But, on the other hand, the Puerta del Sol is just a hundred metres away.

There was mold in the bathrooms and the rooms were not very clean. I guess you get what you pay for so choose wisely. The only thing that was good about this place was the price. I will choose another place to stay going forward.
In the very center of the city. Tiny, quiet rooms. Correct price..
Very centric place. Simple rooms with bathroom but OK for a short stay.

adr_address: Calle de la Cruz, 6, 28012 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de la Cruz, 6, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: Madrid City Rooms

reviews.text: Room is small but double bed even though I booked a single and great powerful shower & clean bathroom. Safe, mini-fridge, clothes rail, locker, TV (Spanish), Air conditioning, comfortable bed and room cleaned daily. In centre of Madrid 3 min walk to Plaza Del Sol, Metro Sol. Great Value. Highly recommended..

The place was perfect for a budget stay over. Small of course, but everything one needs. Spotlessly clean, and very well located. The staff were friendly, helpful and spoke good English.
There are good shops, and restaurants all around. If you look carefully, some very affordable "local" spots.

Cannot recommend it enough! This place is run like a hotel but has the price range of a hostel. Myself & husband came from the canary islands to madrid to renew our passports so weren't necessarily looking for accommodation with flare but were delighted to find they had cleaned the room and changed the towels whilst we were out. They had room service available, wifi hairdryer, smart tv (netflix!), plus all normal. Would go back time and time again & the location is brilliant right neer plza del sol 👌🏼👏🏼😍

Fantastic location for travelling around everywhere. No lift as the stairs are protected by the Spanish government so they cannot replace them. Didn't bother me though but may be difficult for those who have trouble with stairs as the reception is on the second floor. 

Clean and spotless. Reception and staff are fantastic. Couldn't ask for more.

I have attached photos of the entrance as I was a bit anxious to find it.
Very clean and well furnished rooms, helpful receptionist and in a good corner of Madrid with a lot of options for dining and entertainment.

adr_address: Calle de Esparteros, 6, 28012 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Esparteros, 6, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: Hostal Madrid

reviews.text:
We actually made a reservation to the Mayor center apartments operating by Hostal Madrid.
It's at very convenient location，ssurrounding by tons restaurants, and 2 minutes walk to metro or Hop-on Hop-off bus stops.
The hotel check-in staffs were very friendly, they prepared local maps, and walked with us to our apartment.
We had a 2B-2B apartment, super comfortable.
Enjoyed the stay, and recommending to everyone.
Nice place! Apartments are nice and open with lots of space!

It's a classic room in a central location of Madrid.  There is a working elevator and all the basics you'll need.  We found the convenient access to Sol a tremendous convenience for our visit to Madrid.
Barebones and beautiful. Basic amenities, no-frills, but not plain. Location cannot be beat at a value.
Great location nice friendly place.

adr_address: Tres Cruces, 3, 28013 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Tres Cruces, 3, 28013 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Anaco

reviews.text: The security guard wouldn’t let me into the property I therefore could not check in. This was dissspointing as I lost £100 as a result. I would strongly advise booking elsewhere.
Very distressed Hotel, but for a city break quite acceptable. Beds clean and fresh linen. Shower hot and powerful. Nothing more needed as out all the time. Very central so perfect for exploring.
Hotel Anaco is very clean, nice peoples, very near from center of madrid, peurto del sol, gran via street, also economic hotel, i suggest it to any body nead to visit madrid

Stayed here for two nights whilst watching spurs play Real Madrid.
Absolutely no complaints upgraded my room for me, great side view of the city.
If you just need a base for a few days this was absolutely perfect.

For the price as well you won’t go far wrong, never found the restaurant though!
Good for the price. Does no have ac. Room was a constant 80ish degrees. The front desk doesn't use computers. All of the info was put on paper.

adr_address: 34, Calle Sta. Leonor, 28037 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: 34, Calle Sta. Leonor, 28037 Madrid, Spain
name: Travelodge Madrid Alcala

reviews.text: here requests 4 euro for the internet access at your room but the speed was so much slow, less than 100kb/s. the lobby has free wifi - I do not know how much fast in the lobby.

Stayed at the hotel 29th Jan30th Jan 2019.   Lovely clean hotel.  The staff were so helpful, especially the afternoon/evening reception  staff who went above and beyond their duties to be helpful.  Thank you so much you are a credit to the Company.
It is like any other Travelodge, quiet and calm. Shower room is medium size and fine, while main section of the room is just ok

For a one-star hotel, this is perfect. Clean, reasonably spacious, everything looks "new" and works as expected.

Slightly annoying:
- charging extra for wifi in the room (not much), 
- upfront payment by my company was not possible.
Horrible shower. No value for the money. Everything extra. E.g. No complimentary water bottle, no tissue box, pathetic WiFi.

adr_address: Calle Ruiz de Alda, 6, 28342 Valdemoro, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle Ruiz de Alda, 6, 28342 Valdemoro, Madrid, Spain
name: Victoria

reviews.text: Very Nice food. Very Nice straff! Recommended

The smell makes it  impossible to to live there. The television didn't work. It took the staff an hour to get me taxi. 3 star 2 star hotel or hostel. They just couldn't make up their mind what it was.. it was a one star nightmare
A small hotel with simple equipment, a little too noisy, just for staying at night if you are going to spend a couple of days in Parque Warner.
Friendly staff, good location with (limited) private parking. Old rooms with old furniture​, no mini bar. It had plenty of light coming from big windows. Breakfast was ok, nothing special.
Great quality/price ratio. All correct at great price. We went to Warner park 15 minutes away.

adr_address: C/ de la Cruz, 33, 28012 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: C/ de la Cruz, 33, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: JQC Rooms

reviews.text: Good place. Very close to centro and Atocha train station. Rooms clean and well furnished.
The good thing about is the location! The rooms are quite small,but its good for a short stay and a low budget!
Everything u need from hostel u can find there, rooms are small but clean. AC works fine. Sometimes i needed to wait for hot water. Only this is reason for 4 stars.
lovely newly referbed Hostal,  very clean,  cosy and in a great place close to all the attractions, shops, restaurants and transport
Nice bedroom witth private wc, all new a very clean. Very good for a small hostel

adr_address: Plaza del Ángel, 12, 28012 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Plaza del Ángel, 12, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: Hostal Persal

reviews.text: We were looking for a good place for the night and found this place for a family of four. Price was reasonable and it was at the city center. Staffs are friendly and it was in a safer environment.
Computer stolen from entrance. Seems to be  haunt for thieves, staff couldn't be bothered
For a 2* Hostal they are excellent. Good central location. Try to avoid arriving Fri or Sat evenings as the local streets are heaving.

spooky vibes but in a good way. v clean!! everything is nice and the staff are lovely and helpful and at the front desk they speak excellent english. also good location, lots to do in the surrounding area

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights.
The hotel is very central to exploring Madrid, within walking distance of all tourist attractions.
The hotel and rooms are very clean.
  The reception staff at the hotel are very friendly, courteous and responsive to any request.
  Hotel highly recommended.

adr_address: Autovía de Extremadura, Km. 28,2, 28600 Navalcarnero, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Autovía de Extremadura, Km. 28,2, 28600 Navalcarnero, Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Ciudad de Navalcarnero

reviews.text: Your typical road side hotel/motel. Quiet and they have a really good breakfast for the price.
Nice hotel friendly staff and good food overall good experience.
Very calm place
Comodo

Perfecte per una parada i fonda. Les habitacions que donen a l'autovia són impecablement insonoritzades, cap problema, no se sent res de res. Molt bé en comoditat i netedat. El menjar, sense ser dolent, el vaig trobar millorable, però correcte.

adr_address: Calle de Zorrilla, 13, 28014 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Zorrilla, 13, 28014 Madrid, Spain
name: Hostal Olga

reviews.text: Very good hostel, clean, good size rooms, nice bathroom, friendly staff. For the price is not bad at all. They always try to keep everything clean. The heater for the bedroom didn't work so the first night it was a little bit cold, but apart from that, it was good.
Clean, nice room and bathroom. Daily cleaning. 24 hours service. Affordable price. Only missing part is no inside breakfast or bar, but that is not a real problem
Fine cheap hotel. Very close to city.
Very simple accommodation but nice people running it which is the main thing. Close to Prado and center. Not noisy like some hostals despite 24 hour reception.
Very friendly and helpful staff. Great location. Central and safe. Good room for the money.

adr_address: Calle de la Victoria, 6, 28012 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de la Victoria, 6, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: Barbieri SOL Hostel

reviews.text: Clean and calm . Except the voice comming from bars outside which they stay open late. Everything is good
The owner is crazy rude the rooms are small but fine the position it's very good although the owner is very rude.
It was nice, small but confi, clean and breakfast was ok, it has nice view and it's really close to the plaza called sol
Clean hostel, friendly staff, although they could work on their English. Nevertheless a very friendly environment. Very close to the city center and several pubs and clubs, which  is very nice.

This hostel was a phenomenal value! The location is ideal, in a very safe and vibrant area that isn't too touristic. The daily breakfast was terrific and the rooms and bathrooms were very clean! The atmosphere is social and meeting new friends is relatively easy. When I revisit Madrid, I will return to Barbieri. Your money won't go further!

adr_address: Carrer de Laforja, 98-100, 08021 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer de Laforja, 98-100, 08021 Barcelona, Spain
name: Hostal Alogar

reviews.text:
I really enjoyed staying at this hostel! It's located near the city centre, but on quiet alley; there are many markets, shops and restaurants nearby; the staff is kind and the rooms are clean.The rooms have air-conditioning and a hair dryer. Another big plus is that there is a fully equipped kitchen for you to cook.  One minor drawback is that my room had only 2 electrical outlets,one was place inconveniently. There was a third one but broken.
Overall I think that for the money you couldn't ask for better conditions.

I stayed here for two days and it was wonderful. It is a great place to stay if you are looking for a quiet space and professional staff. There was a moment where I thought my computer charger went missing and I went to the staff (very upset) and they helped me look for it (it was in my bag the whole time...). I appreciated that they didn't get defensive or upset at me during that process. I highly recommend!

Excellent hostal! Diego at the desk was very kind. The hostal is very clean and the cleaner Francesca also very kind and she did a great job. There are 2 bathrooms for all the shared-bath rooms. You always get clean towels and you also get locker in the shared kitchen and a place in the shared refrigerator.
We've got small room with big bed and sink in the room.
It feels very comfortable to stay there and the location was far from the center but the good transportation and the super price made it very very good place to host in Barcelona.
We would like to stay there again!
Amazing staff..Very helpful... Good tidy rooms cleaned everyday..And good kitchen for morning tea and breakfast...Absolutely loved it...
One of the best hostels in Barcelona. Reasonable price and not so far from the center of the city. The hostel is so clean and peaceful. Staff are also so kind.

adr_address: Ronda de Sant Antoni, 61, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Ronda de Sant Antoni, 61, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
name: Hostal Delfos

reviews.text: Very convenient location, near metro and airport bus stop. It was also near many bakeries and eateries. The reception staff was warm and helpful. Room was relavtovely clean. If you are very sensitive to bed quality, maybe this place isn't for you, but if you're on a budget it's awesome.

It was really nice. Simple but had everything you need. After all, you're probably just going there to sleep. The bed is comfortable. 
Private room but public bathroom. You get towels and shampoo and body wash. 
Your room even has a sink. 
Very good location. In the center. 
Staff is very kind and helpful, not always speak English though.
It was PERFECT, but the room was not clean enough. Thank you for everything lovely employees and an amazing placement! I will never forget this experience!

Perfect location in center of Barcelona, from metro station you walk out straight to hostel's door. You can leave your bags for free after check-out.

Part of staff don't speak english at all. Room was clean but a lot of noise from building's facilities during the night. Internet is some kind of misunderstanding, it works like a dial-up connection.
Nice hostal and good location but lift too small

adr_address: Carrer de la Portaferrissa, 23, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer de la Portaferrissa, 23, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
name: Hostal Residència Rembrandt

reviews.text: The only good thing is the position. The rooms are very modest and the walls are so thin that you can hear everything. For sure there are much better places for the same money.

I feel like this place is very underrated by the other reviews. In my opinion it's very good for the price. 
Pros: The location is perfect, in the heart of Barcelona. The room and the toilets are clean. The receptionist was nice. Our beds were made every day and we got clean towels and soap. There is a sink and a heater in the room. 
Cons: The balcony door doesn't close because it was painted so many times that it's impossible to close it now. This makes the room pretty loud.

It is what it is, a budget hostel, although it works perfectly as a base camp. It's okay, bathrooms are well... You'd wanna bring slippers. On the other hand drive, it is right in the middle of everything!

Four stars for my overall experience of staying there. The location is fantastic with the accomodation being somewhat, more budget, than I am used to - but I wanted to stay in the Gothic Quarter and this was the only available option at the time. The staff were friendly, helpful and accomodating. The shared bathrooms were clean as was my room. For what it is, solo independent and budget travellers are probably most suited to, but then, really....you'll miss out on this prime real estate of a spot if you aren't one of the above.

Room was small but clean, bathroom in the room also clean, I can't complain. Reception- very helpfully. Pleace excellent, everywhere very close, in 2-3 min you find nice place to eat, Market whit delicious. If I go again to Barcelona I will choose Rembrandt

adr_address: Carrer Gran de Gràcia, 239, 08012 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer Gran de Gràcia, 239, 08012 Barcelona, Spain
name: Hostal Lesseps

reviews.text: They were really friendly,will help you with everything,my room was small but quiet and warm,my window was looking at the inside of building but still had enough light. Room is cleaned every day! They are really close to Metro station Lesseps so you can go everywhere
Fantastic hostel. Very clean rooms. Friendly staff. 2nd time here for us. Perfect location.

I stay in a singel room.
The is very small but cleen.
The stuff was friendly and helpfull.
Two minutes walking from metro station.

A very small hostel, more of a big home inside a building. The hostesses are very nice, but the rooms are not very well equipped (no AC, no glass cups, no safe...). It is a nice place to be if you only want to sleep fast and not pay too much in Barcelona.
Beautiful,clean,cosy. There is everything you need,hosts are friendly and helpful.

adr_address: Carrer del Manyà, 3, 08569 Rupit-Pruit, Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer del Manyà, 3, 08569 Rupit-Pruit, Barcelona, Spain
name: Fonda Marsal

reviews.text:
We stopped here for a quick lunch. There were 20 of us and were expecting confusion with the ordering  and service. But, hats off to Alba who served us.
The service was excellent and quick,  the food was very tasty! Very friendly!
A great place!!
Most memorable Paelle in the mountains of Spain. What wonderful people and food!
In the centre of Rupit. Comfortable rooms, decent breakfast and not too expensive
Quality food for a reasonable price.

The food is simple but tasty and you get wine, water, bread, a huge starter, a big meal, and dessert for 14€. The place is rustic and well kept as well. 

No complaints!

adr_address: Carrer de Can Viloca, 52, 08204 Sabadell, Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer de Can Viloca, 52, 08204 Sabadell, Barcelona, Spain
name: Pensión los Martínez

reviews.text: No dar dinero NUNCA A ESTA PERSONAS POR ADELANTANDO.! ME COBRARON 350€ POR 28 DIAS.! A LOS 13 días me pidieron que tenía que pagar o irme. Me robaron mi dinero y papeles cuando limpiaban..! Una estafa ya las denuncie y demandé.! NO RECOMENDABLE.,.!
Agradable y tranquila distancia y me tocó con un patio al aire libre ,compartido, la mar de agradable

reviews.author_name: Mujer Casos de la vida Real
reviews.text: No te atienden del todo bien... no hay aire acondicionado... las duchas son muy pequeñas...les molesta si comes en el cuarto... en conclusión pues no esta mal pero pues eso que tienen que mejorar la atención al cliente
Se come muy bien esta todo buenisimo lo recomiendo mucho
Los enchufes no van, el sitio mas cutre np puede ser, la limpieza poco y la verdad no lo recomiendo

adr_address: Carrer del Roser, 40, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer del Roser, 40, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
name: Hostal Barcelona

reviews.text: Perfect Location: close to Metro, tapas bars just at the corner, close to the center. Not expensive, good room service and very friendly people. You can find all you need. Highly recommended!

Please be aware, that the pictures on their website DO NOT match with the reality! 
Our stay was not as comfortable as we thought it would be.. It was bearable, but our room was shocking in the first moment. 

And the rooms are not quiet!! Ever single noise in the house can be heard. 

Be careful people!

Although we did not end up staying at Hostal Barcelona, my girlfriend and I had planned a dream trip to Barcelona, and then upon arriving on our first night late, realized we’d accidentally booked for the following year instead of the current one. Jean, the manager, was very understanding and not only did he fully refund us, but also helped us find another place at a friendly discount. Amazing customer service. Thanks again Jean for the help, you saved our trip!

-Michael and Carson
In one word: terrible. If i could give 0 stars i would have.

Nothing wrong with the staff or general cleanliness, everything was decent. Wifi was bad but biggest problem is the location. Hostal is right above a very crowded area that gets extremely load at night until up to 3am and you can hear everything. I had trouble sleeping.

adr_address: La Rambla, 133, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: La Rambla, 133, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
name: Barcelona City Ramblas

reviews.text:
Not really my Hotel /guesthouse.
On the fourth floor.
No elevator
Stairs are old and sleppery
I had a small room and I asked for larger room whitch I didn't get that makes it for me not really reable service to the custermers.
Keys have to get them from different location.
If you are along with a small luggage this is a great place.
It's in the heart of Barcelona
Everything is close by.
Train and metro station plaça Catalunya
Good place. Room was okay, nothing special.

Fourth floor, no lift. You need to notify your arrival time. 
Reception is not opened 24 hours.
Ideal central location. walking distance to many tourist attractions, shops and restaurants.
Two of the rooms have good views of Las Ramblas.
There is a common fridge, microwave and a computer to use. Free Wifi but sometimes it doesn't work.
I stay there often because of the price and location.
Wonderful place to spend time, educated people. loved it!

We paid €310 for 4 nights for a small room without ac or a simple fan, mattress with blood stains, very humid room, and cockroaches, just one toilet for all the guests. Cheap doesn't mean filthy or rooms for second class people. Family with kids or younger adults deserve a clean and welcoming place. It's true that the location is great but almost impossible to sleep well, due the humidity and the heat inside the room. I asked for another mattress and the receptionist did change.

adr_address: Carrer de Jaume I, 11, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer de Jaume I, 11, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
name: Hotel Jaume I

reviews.text: Location is perfect, not expensive, staff was friendly and the room was clean. Room was very small, it was noisy (like there is no walls), hot water was not very hot all the time. There is no ari conditioner, it was ok at this part of the year, but in the summer this will be a very big problem.
Location location location! Amazing location! Close to everything, metro, stores, squares, restaurants.. Reception desk was really friendly.. Big respect for them!
You don't keep your key to your room when you leave.  It feels more like a hostel than a hotel.  Would be fine if they charged hostel prices.  No AC.
Staying here for 4 night. Extremely friendly staff. The room is clean. Sights, tapas and beach are close
Very clean, friendly staff and the location is amazing! Also many nice restaurants nearby

adr_address: Carretera de Barcelona, 82, 08840 Viladecans, Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carretera de Barcelona, 82, 08840 Viladecans, Barcelona, Spain
name: ibis Budget Aeropuerto Barcelona Viladecans

reviews.text: So much better than I thought it would be. Really nice rooms and very welcoming. Short cab ride to airport and good local bar for breakfast

Smart , no nonsense accommodation with friendly, professional staff and comfortable rooms.
Very affordable for level of service.
Great location. Clean, modern, friendly staff, felt safe there. Would stay again !
Nice+clean hotel just 10 minutes away from T1 and T2 Airport Barcelona.

Very good place for accommodation. We have spent here 4 days. Breakfast OK - typically continental breakfast. One disadvantage - far from the center of Barcelona, but bus stop is located very close to hotel. Rooms very clean. McDonalds and Aldi located close to the hotel.

adr_address: Carrer Nou de la Rambla, 50, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer Nou de la Rambla, 50, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
name: Hostal Barcelona Ramblas

reviews.text: Rooms were okay, the staff was friendly and the location was just perfect. Walking out straight in the center

Bang for your buck! It's not the most exclusive place but you really get what you're paying for. We got a double en suite private room for 3 nights for €150. The room was clean, refurbished and fresh toilets and shower, balcony, and cleaning done every morning. Rooms did not feel like a hostel. Staff was also very accommodating and available at anytime during the day/night. They even let us store our bikes in the hallway and storage room! Would strongly recommend for the price, location, and quality of this hostel.
2 supermarkets, air conditioning, nice location, nice staff and the common bathroom is not that messy
Comfortable.
Great place to stay. Right in the middle of everything

vicinity: Carrer Nou de la Rambla, 50, Barcelona

adr_address: Carrer de la Portaferrissa, 11, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer de la Portaferrissa, 11, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
name: Hostal Fina

reviews.text: Except for a bit of street noise, it was a great room with a great system for when you arrive late (they give you a code to get into the house), you can store your luggage after checkout. I think I could come again :)
Excellent intalations. Clean and comfortable
Good place to spend the night and rest, the staff so friendly and kind, terrific location close to everywhere.
Super Hostel! A bit small but enough if you go there only for sleeping. Location is super central. 1 min to La Rambla
Excellent location.  Good rooms and bathroom. Helpful staff.

adr_address: Carrer del Turisme, 42, 08370 Calella,Barcelona, Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer del Turisme, 42, 08370 Calella,Barcelona, Barcelona, Spain
name: Hotel Bernat II

reviews.text:
The good parts: rooms are rather newly renovated and equipped with modern furniture. They are also clean. Staff at the restaurant is great and so is the food.
I was not pleased with the location of the hotel (directly at the main road), the balconies (quite run down and tiny), the noise inside the hotel (you can hear everything from the neighbours rooms) and also staff at reception was not overly friendly and welcoming. This could certainly improved.

Managed to get a room at a discounted price and for that it was great. The staff was very nice and speaks multiple languages, the rooms were decently sized and clean. The buffet for dinner and breakfast had a nice selection of hot and cold food which was all very delicious. The hotel is not far from the beach and has a few stores nearby. Overall a great experience, would definitely stay there again.
A special place with very warm and kind people! Very good food as you can see in my pictures! A place where you want to come back anytime!

Everything was great, I had all the meals and drinks included. The handling was very good and diversified, a lot of seafood in the menu. Staff of Note 10, very helpful and attentive to the needs of the clients. The hotel is very well positioned, 5 minutes from the beach. We will definitely come back.

It’s a good hotel with friendly service. I was there in winter so it was not very full. The facilities are quite old and simple. It’s not a four star hotel for sure. But ok for a short stay. It’s just 5 minutes walk from the beach.

adr_address: Carrer de Buenaventura Muñoz, 16, 08018 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer de Buenaventura Muñoz, 16, 08018 Barcelona, Spain
name: Arc House Barcelona

reviews.text: Good design, big common room and I had really good price for a bed. But any additional service cost more money.

You cannot lock the shower room, which is really awkward if you stay in a mixed room. I book the wrong date (Spanish date shows date/month/year, which is different from USA month/date/year. So I didn't pay attention). They don't refund nor change the date for me, asking me to cancel without giving me refund. I feel really sad.

Good hostel located near Station North in Barcelona. They have good rates and if you book via their website you'll have a late check-out at 1pm, a free towel and a free drink (water or a soft drink) included in the price. There's storage in the rooms but you'll need to bring your own lock or buy one at the reception. It wasn't too clean (toilets could be cleaned more throughoutly and more often) and the staff didn't give any advice on places to go etc. Walls are thin which can be really annoying at night when people are loud regardless of the quite time. Anyway, still a good stay for a night or two.
Nice hostel, clean, quiet, comfy bed and great location really close to the city center

This is an amazing hostel. They expect you to understand English from the get go. This is because they at first assume you don't. They will charge your credit card and then as send polite mails to state "we will charge your credit card if you stay with us".
Go here for a lesson in guest relations and an amazing stay. Also make sure you can pay! Else they'll charge you ten Euros for a late check in.

adr_address: Carrer de Còrsega, 541, 08025 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer de Còrsega, 541, 08025 Barcelona, Spain
name: Hotel Sagrada Familia

reviews.text: Absolute gem of a hotel, situated so close to the Sagrada Familia Basilica. Friendly helpful staff. Breakfast choice and quality very good. Rooms clean, tidy, modern and well equipped. Ideal base when visiting Barcelona. Well recommended and we will return.

Super value! Tania was the most helpful and friendly recepcionist I have encountered in ages. Super convenient if you want to visit Sagrada Familia and see it different times light throughout the day. Loved the bathtub and the additional towels and the coffeemaker in the room! Will be back for sure.

Very nice and quiet place. I spend like 6 nights there and it was great. Is very close to the cathedral sagrada, (that was the reason why I booked this hotel). Depending on the room, you can have a nice view from the window. Good personal.

Stayed here last year about 6months ago and I was bitten by bed bugs, I confirmed this with two separate friends who had also experienced bed bug bites while abroad. Staff were adamant I was wrong because 'there was no blood on the sheets' and made me go to hospital in the middle of the night to get the bites seen where we waited to be seen for SEVEN hours instead of just letting us switch rooms. And even then they were standoffish and rude about it and adamant we were in the wrong. I had massive noticeable scars up my legs for months after and felt like they didn't care because we were English. Shocked and disgusted to see others have had the same experience with bed bugs as I did. I wasn't going to leave this review until I saw other people had the same happen to them
Brilliant service. Beautiful , modern hotel just few steps from Sagrada Familia and the u derground sation, so conviniently located. Clean, well equipped rooms. What else would you want?

adr_address: Carrer de Laureà Miró, 278, 08950 Esplugues de Llobregat, Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer de Laureà Miró, 278, 08950 Esplugues de Llobregat, Barcelona, Spain
name: Hostal Lami

reviews.text: for the price you are getting nice clean hotel. only problem is that is too far away from centre. But if you handling public transport well, is not big problem in the end.
The parking is tight but it is great to have. I wish it was cheaper though.
Always very clean and friendly staff.5 min from the hospital San Joan de Deu. Perfect.

Excellent services! GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY! Nice and clean rooms (cleanedup daily), good food at breakfast and plenty of everything. The sfaff is nice and ready to help you with any advice you need .
If you want to visit Barcelona, it's easy to get in the city center from this hotel. 
I definetly reccomend this hotel!
Rooms weren't very clean but good service

vicinity: Carrer de Laureà Miró, 278, Esplugues de Llobregat

adr_address: Carrer del Capità Arenas, 51, 08034 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer del Capità Arenas, 51, 08034 Barcelona, Spain
name: Bonanova Park

reviews.text: Small and affordable hotel located in good neighborhood close to metro and many groceries. Single bed room was smaller than expected, but it fulfilled its purpose. Breakfast was very tasty and palatable.

You have to leave the key when you go out, so you have to stand in line to get it when you get back. Some of the receptionists were particularly unpleasent, so being forced to interact with them in this way was not nice. 

Also:
- poor wifi 
- tiny and smelly room
- very thin walls, you can hear everything tjat goes on in the neighbor room.

One good thing: checkout was no until noon, which was nice, especially when you have a late flight.

Far from a subway stop, 30 minutes far from Sagrada Familia by taxi. It's a two star hotel with a price of three, bad smelling (looks like they try to conceal mould smell with lots of perfume). We had to open the bedroom windows in the midst of a wintry night because we couldn't stand it. Painful reception, not a smile, just simply don't care. Wouldn't come back even if it were the only hotel available.
Room small, but pleasant. No plastic shower and no funny hangers.  Good breakfast,  surprisingly good machine coffee
Walls are very thin. Can hear everything the person next door’s saying

adr_address: Carrer de São Paulo, 33-37, 08030 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer de São Paulo, 33-37, 08030 Barcelona, Spain
name: NH La Maquinista

reviews.text: Really comfortable and well equipped rooms. Friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is located next to the biggest shopping center/mall. I thought it will be a bit far from the city centre, but there are several ways to get there. Most of them are easy and doesn't take more than 30 minutes. You can take bus, metro and train as well. I would choose this hotel for my next trip again. Thanks!

Below are photos of bed bugs I found in my room when I walked in. I was absolutely horrified and went straight back to the front desk. I kindly asked that they give me another room but they refused to do so, and instead told me bring up the matter with the cleaning staff. Needless to say I was downright irate at this point, and demanded that I speak with the manager, but the lady at the front told me that he was away for (conveniently) 3 days (the length of my stay). So you're telling me that the hotel doesn't have a manager for 3 days? You're either lying to to me stay out of trouble, or this hotel truly has a management and staff training issue. I will never, ever stay at a NH hotel again, and will advise my touring agency of this incident and warn my friends and family to stay away from this horrifying place. I've been to tens of hotels in my life, but none have been as terrible as this experience.

Myself and eleven of my family were moved here as our plane was cancelled. We were swiftly checked in and were very pleased with our rooms. One receptionist  in particular was exceptional. Christina printed us out new boarding passes and  all of our rooms for an extra night as we were delayed for three days. The hotel is very clean and has all room amenities you could possibly need. Thanks to all the staff for accommodating all of us at this stress full time

Good and kind service
Locaction is good
Breakfast is very good
Rooms are nice and clean

Nice place to stay for a few days.  Comfortable rooms and friendly staff.  Close to shops, transport and nice local cafes but it might be a bit far out for some people for a shorter stay.  It was perfect for us.

adr_address: Carrer de l'Hospital, 107 bis, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer de l'Hospital, 107 bis, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
name: Hostal Nou Raval

reviews.text: The place is in the city centre that makes it easy if you are on foot and subway nearby as well. Staff was very friendly too. But way too expensive for what it is. When we saw the room we were very disappointed - very small with one tiny window, smelly. We had a contant problem with opening the door to the room because the lock was broken and staff could not do anything about it. The bathroom without proper door, dirty. There was a cleaning service but not doing the job properly. Breakfast very basic - croissant and coffee. Not worth it either. Would never recommend it to anyone or else you like cockroaches walking around.

Me stay was cheap and what I got was accordingly. I was happy enough, everything worked and was nice. My only comment would be the beds, we stayed four four nights and the two second one were a bit much. So, in conclusion, shorter stay, sure, pick this place!

I had this really bad encounter with Mr. Diop from the front desk. He was unprofessional from the day of the check-in throughout my whole stay of 1 week. I once forgot to leave the key, so he yelled at me like crazy. He highly lacked concentration, which may have to do with his drug consumption as we once caught him smoke week outside the building.  When we once asked for some restaurant tips he declined helping us, because he had friends visiting him and was not bothered to loose time with us. I even heard him make racist comments against white folks once. Just because of this horrible staff member I cannot give this Hostel more than 1 star, sorry!
It's a nice Hostal and friendly staffs
The best shawarma in BCN the place name Perejil en calle hospital número 92

adr_address: Av. Can Corts, 11-13, 08940 Cornellà de Llobregat, Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Av. Can Corts, 11-13, 08940 Cornellà de Llobregat, Barcelona, Spain
name: Hotel NH Cornellá

reviews.text: Good hotel with spacious room and great breakfast. If you arriva in the late night there is a free service for snacks.
The environment is very quiet and the staff is very professional. Good customer services and good diet.
It was great indeed with 100 euro n all good facilities
Gym and equipment not as good as photos but still a nice hotel with friendly staff.
This is what happens when you do not expect anything special from a hotel and you face great service, delicious breakfast, clean rooms and comfortable location (airport, metro, Sants station).

vicinity: Avinguda Can Corts, 11-13, Cornellà de Llobregat

adr_address: Carrer Gran de Gràcia, 87, 08012 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer Gran de Gràcia, 87, 08012 Barcelona, Spain
name: Pensión Norma

reviews.text:
Extremely uncomfortable and unpleasant to stay in. Though the shared bathroom is OK, the rest is not worth the price. 
We also had a room with a window to the inner staircase, so that it wasn’t possible to open it and let some oxygen inside🤢 We were not aware of that! It was very hot and the tiny ventilator on the wall didn’t help.
You also have to carry the luggage upstairs, which is a real torture.

Poor quality hotel. I have been in Barcelona during summer. Me and my girlfriend experienced a lot of cheap hotels without air conditioner and it turned out fine, but this one... I would'nt recommend it to my worst ennemy. No air at all in the room. It's says it was on a second floor, turned out it's on fourth floor and even higher because it was a kind of split level building. Really, really hot. Temperature outside: 23 °C. Actually we could'nt sleep at all. We had to leave the door open overnight so a little bit of air could enter the room and we chose to pay a little bit more to have a private room, but you guess, with the door open no privacy at all. Fan at max power all night, but really noisy. Of all the OK cheap hotels and hostels we tried in Catalunya, this one is easily the worst experience we had. Wifi does'nt work in the room, only outside and there is only one shower for the whole floor.

A good value for money. The rooms were very clean and tidy which was a nice point. The employees speak a very rudimentar english but enough to get around.
The room was a bit hot but there was a fan which helped.
Decent staff and a decent place, but a bit towards the dilapidated side
Well priced. The shared bathroom was kept clean.

adr_address: Passeig de la Marina, 139, 08860 Castelldefels, Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Passeig de la Marina, 139, 08860 Castelldefels, Barcelona, Spain
name: Hotel 139

reviews.text: Room is small but cozy, loved the balcony and hospitality of all the staffs

Home away from home. The hotel is basic, but nice and clean. 2 blocks from the beach, but what makes it special is the attitude!
Thank you Julio & Vanessa for making us feel so welcome and loved! You were wonderful, and we really appreciate your great energy and love!
We already miss you :-)
Very nice hotel, kind staff, clean and bright room, good food.

Very close to the beach and a bus stop. 
Excellent dinners (starter, main course, dessert). Drinks included (wine, beer, sangria, coffee, tea - whatever you want). 
Breakfasts are disappointing though. No scrambled eggs nor bacon. Wrinkled tomatoes. Poor choice of pastry (only baguettes, tost bread, and little croissants for dessert).

Super cute hotel near a beach the locals use. Lots of bars and restaurants are within walking distance.  Was able to park right out front and it was reasonably priced.  15 minutes to the airport.  Perfect!

address_components.long_name: Carrer de la Riera de Sant Miquel
address_components.short_name: Carrer de la Riera de Sant Miquel

adr_address: Carrer de la Riera de Sant Miquel, 74, 08006 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer de la Riera de Sant Miquel, 74, 08006 Barcelona, Spain
name: DingDong Express

reviews.text: Good price and good room. The pillows were rubbish, but the rest was nice. You can easily hear the noise outside, which is not good.

Good value for money. Rapid access to bus and metro stations. We had a shared bathroom at two rooms of 2, but it was clean and really close to the room. Overall it was a good choice for the money paid.
Very clean & tidy cheap budget place.basic amenities but adequate.close to transport so easy to get about and plenty of shops and bars nearby.
Room was super clean and warm.  The shared toilet was also always spotless.

Hotel room itself was decent but we had a problem with paying. We tried to use the automatic payment machine in the lobby, but apparently it was out of paper. No big deal right?

 We called and an employee came and manually checked us in and because the machine could not vend a key or receipt, she asked if we could pay in euro. The issue came once I was back in America and noticed my payment was charged on my Visa ( I payed for the room with cash). I emailed the contact us link and told them about the issue and they were quick to respond that they would look into it and refund my money on the credit card. 4 business days go by and no communication. I rewrite an email requesting the status of my refund and no word. Another email was send days later....silence. Last email written stated I would contact my credit card if they didn't fix this....

They didn't and I had to go through with the hassle of refuting the payment. Shame on you Dingdongs. You could have had the decency to refund my money after I was clearly double charged. I even emailed a copy of my receipt to them proving I double paid. I would give 0 stars just because of the bad business ethic.

vicinity: Carrer de la Riera de Sant Miquel, 74, Barcelona

adr_address: Travessera de Gràcia, 380-384, 08025 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Travessera de Gràcia, 380-384, 08025 Barcelona, Spain
name: Hotel H·TOP BCN City

reviews.text: Stayed here with a group of 13 children and 3 adults from our football club. The place was basic, but exceptionally clean, with comfortable beds and an AMAZING shower! The hotel is near the metro station, in a nice quiet part of the city and the breakfast was decent for such a reasonable price. If you're on a budget, then this hotel is a great choice!
Normal place if you need just where to sleep, too much easy breakfast and you will know everything what in neighbor rooms are
find nice people as an assistant and I think everything is clean. only ferry from the center 12 minutes by taxi

Stayed here one night. Friendly staff. The room was fine in size. Nice toiletries. But mouldy smell and small bugs crawling in corner on wall in room. 2 star hotel expectations. Would only stay here for a night or two due to the smell/small bugs.

Rooms are clean, modestly-priced, and very safe. They took my boyfriend and me in while scrambling in the middle of the night to find somewhere to stay because we missed our flight so I'm obviously a fan. Shower has amazing pressure. They give you towels, soap, toothbrushes, etc. and there's a cleaning crew in the afternoon. Perfect location. Literally saved our lives.

adr_address: C Energia, 1, 08740 Sant Andreu de la Barca, Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: C Energia, 1, 08740 Sant Andreu de la Barca, Barcelona, Spain
name: Hotel ibis budget Barcelona Sant Andreu de la Barca

reviews.text: Hotel is amazing! Service is on the top of its level. I really enjoyed staying here and can recommend this hotel to stay. Keep it up. And Hi from Kazakhstan:)
I was a very good and warm hotel to live in during my trip in Barcelona, Very Cheap prices with a great service like any other Ibis Hotel :)
Good room Very good bathroom fircility

Got ripped off with the dogs 10 euros each. Room was nice till the ants came out. Informed reception was told our fault as had food in the room. I have food at home but I'm not over run with ants.would not use again.
Very good

vicinity: C Energia, 1, Sant Andreu de la Barca

adr_address: Av. dels Rabassaires, 46, 08100 Mollet del Vallès, Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Av. dels Rabassaires, 46, 08100 Mollet del Vallès, Barcelona, Spain
name: B&B Hotel Barcelona Mollet

reviews.text:
Never again, it was like sleeping on the hard shoulder of the M1!The noise from the motorway was horrendous. Bedroom window didn't close properly. Electronic door keys had to be reprogrammed everyday which was a pain when you go up to your room only to have to come back down. 
Never had enough bowels for breakfast and if we asked for more they didn't have any! 
Bathroom sink was blocked and leaked. Never fixed in the 5 days we stayed. Others in our group also had all of the above problems.
Customer service was not great during the day but evening staff were very helpful and apologetic.
Good location for F1 circuit.   Very helpful staff.  Be happy to stay here again
Very good hotel

Good hotel for the price. Don't stay on a room near the elevators. Many people arrive at 23h to 1h and you won't be able to sleep. The same people at 7h are running the corridor. Many supermarkets and restaurants near by. 10m to train station walking and 20m by train to the city center. Good neighborhood.

Hey B&B,

You have a nice receptionist but ridiculous corporate rules, need to pay immediately on the check-in and can't be charged on the check-out... It's nice to mistrust your client, perfect first impression B&B.

About the hotel room, it's poorly insulated (you hear how your neighbour caugh behind the wall) & all stuff in the room and especially the so called "bathroom" is SO cheapie... but it's not the end.
The second best part
 about "bathroom" is not a real one, it's just a glass box in your room, without air extraction so when you quit the bathroom all the steam is in your room, free sauna, great wet experience for your sleep!

And for the end, free Wi-Fi but no signal in the room (20 meters from the reception desk).

Never ever again B&B.

vicinity: Avinguda dels Rabassaires, 46, Mollet del Vallès

adr_address: Carrer del Comte Borrell, 208, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer del Comte Borrell, 208, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
name: Hotel Zenit Borrell

reviews.text: The staff here are very courteous and helpful. The food in the restaurant was delicious, and the place is fresh and clean too.
This hotel is not too bad. Kerb appeal’s not great but priced well for a weekend. Customer service was great, rooms and beds comfy. A good location for nearby bars and restaurants. Would visit again.

Increased to 4 stars since the manager actually cares. Initially I put 3 stars since it is, for me, a hotel like I expect a hotel to be and 3 stars is in the middle. But the room was clean and the bed was very good so I can highly recommend going there. It will be my first choice if I ever go back to Barcelona.
Great hotel, very clean and great location
Was pretty clean and well kept. Staff was also friendly and we had no issues at all in out 3 night stay. Location was decent, but not great.

adr_address: Calle Pau Claris, 104, 08009 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Calle Pau Claris, 104, 08009 Barcelona, Spain
name: Hostal Barcelona Centro

reviews.text: We stayed here 4 nights (tonight is our last night, we are sad to leave tomorrow) and found this to be a wonderful place. The rooms are clean, the place is so quiet, I never saw or heard anyone. It is centrally located and the staff was helpful and friendly. Good price for the location Highly recommended. Thanks
A nice hostel, centrally located, with cosy rooms, quiet, very clean, very comfortable. Highly recommended.

Very nice apartment with spacious communal areas and ample size rooms and bathrooms. Good facilities provided for our short stay. Downside was that it was necessary to be very quiet at night to prevent disturbing neighbours which was a shame when you're on holiday with friends. The apartments should be better soundproofed. Also there was a really bad smell in our apartment on one day and it seemed to be coming from the plumbing or outside.
Pretty good hostal with decent sized rooms fairly close to the city centre and a not too far walk from most places.
Very kind and helpful staff. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Excelent location, near to metro and easy to get to seightseeing places. Also near to supermarkets, drugstores, restaurants...

adr_address: Junto Plaza de Sants, Carrer d'Antoni de Capmany, 82, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Junto Plaza de Sants, Carrer d'Antoni de Capmany, 82, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
name: Hostal Sants

reviews.text: Stayed here 3 times now. Staff are absolutely lovely, location is very central so great for getting around the city and the surrounding area as Sants Estació is only a 5 minute walk. If you stay here around late August then catch the Festival de Sants right out the front door or from your window.
The room is modest with minimum amenities. However the value for money is correct. I woulden't recommend to stay here more than one or two nights.

Noisy, the bathroom smelled bad and the heater was extremely high so we had to sleep without blanket and opened windows in late November... Price wasn't bad but if I knew I'd had payed a bit more for a better hotel
A wonderful place with very kind staff, and good prices. The entire city is easily accessible with subway.

(+)  The location is quite great, right next to the subway station.
Staff was quite ok and check in and out were fast.
The hostel also serves buffet breakfast, which was quite good, but also expensive - 10 euro / person. You can get a better and cheaper experience at a local bakery. 

(-) The room was quite small, but, most importantly, worn out & with old furniture. I did not enjoy it at all. 
Elevator could not keep up with the traffic.
Quite pricey for what it offers.
Shower had a textile curtain that would get sucked in while showering, which was extremely unpleasant, because it was touching me. The whole experience was extremely unpleasant.

vicinity: Junto Plaza de Sants, Carrer d'Antoni de Capmany, 82, Barcelona

adr_address: Carrer de Milena Jesenská, 40, 60, 08206 Sabadell, Barcelona, Spain
formatted_address: Carrer de Milena Jesenská, 40, 60, 08206 Sabadell, Barcelona, Spain
name: Aparthotel Attica 21 Vallès

reviews.text: Overall a good hotel. I stayed there for 4 days and enjoyed it. Rooms are spacious and equipped with a kitchen which is a plus especially for working people. There are a wide range of products for breakfast. Also amenities like the Market are close by. Overall a good place to stay. The only thing is the distance from the town centre.
Very clean comfortable and appointed. Probably 10 minutes outside city centre so own transport essential free parking under cover as well as outside. Breakfast had wide choice of foods
Very good breakfast & nice rooms
Maybe a bit farther from the city centre but perfect for a family.
